title: ['Estate Data Business Analyst']
description:
['Ventia is one of the largest essential services providers in Australia and New Zealand. Our clients are the owners and operators of major infrastructure that is critical to our communities, and we are proud to provide the services to keep it working. No one else does exactly what we do in the way we do it.


In partnership with the Australian Defence Force we are seeking an experienced Estate Data Business Analysts to prepare and process Estate Asset information for the purpose of supporting operational Asset planning activities. This role will work alongside the Estate Data Analysts and will provide technical support to the team and client.

This is a permanent full-time position, based in Melbourne.

The key areas of accountability for this role are: Data Management, Data Integrity & Data Analysis, which also involves;
Understand and translate data from various data sources
Devise and project manage Updates and Continuous improvement to Estate Data
Provide large data extractions in formats requested.
Provide Estate Data Metrics on compliance and Assurance of Asset records.
Provide intelligent insights and advising on how to improve performance of SQL and BI reporting
Build and maintain Team dashboards to enable daily workflow decisions to be made using real time data
Train and coach team members on the efficient use of our system and processes include the roll out of continuous improvement initiatives


To be successful in this role, you will need to be an Efficient problem solver that can work effectively with a high degree of professional autonomy as well as in a team;
4 years minimum in Power BI (including proficiency with DAX queries)
Possess relevant qualifications in Data Science/Data analytics or Engineering is desirable
Demonstrated knowledge and experience with the principles and practices of reporting and data analysis
Exceptional interpersonal and customer relationship skills
Advanced skills in the use of reporting and database enquiry tools (SQL, EXCEL, Power BI)
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel (use of macro’s, pivot tables, formulas, VLOOKUPs VBA)
Demonstrated ability to undertake requirements gathering activities to deliver effective and optimised reporting and analytics services

You must be an Australian Citizen & be able to obtain a ADF Clearance.']

title: ['Rating Analyst - Corporate']
description:
['The Role: Rating Analyst
You will be a critical member to the Corporates Ratings Team. You are responsible for analyzing individual company’s financial performance, competitive industry position and quality of management for analytical purposes. This analysis also includes sectors and market trends.
The Location: Melbourne/ Sydney

The Impact: You will be responsible for the development of spreadsheet statistics and databases and will be actively involved in developing rating committee presentations, portfolio reviews and commentaries.
The Team / The Business: You will be part of a global and multicultural team.

Your skills: Bachelor degree is required. You have in-depth knowledge of the financial and corporate industries. You have strong analytical and research skills.
Our Hiring Manager says: “I’m looking for the kind of person who is passionate to pursue a career in credit research. You will play a key role within the Analytical team assisting resolving client’s needs and assess client’s financial performance, projections and business plan.”
Responsibilities:
Collects economic and financial information specific to a commodity market or organization, conducts market sector or statistical analysis and interprets key market data elements into useful business information
Leverages broad scope of knowledge when performing analysis on data sets
Focuses on theory and concepts, applying quantitative or analytical skills to complete projects/studies/tasks
Conducts research including identifying data, data input, and statistical analysis of results and creates and maintains data and analysis reports
Works closely with senior analysts to ensure most recent information is updated in the financial model.
Support senior analysts to prepares presentations and participate the meetings with clients.
Requirements:
Bachelor degree in commerce, finance, accounting or related subjects
Pursuing CPA or CFA designation will be ideal
2 - 3 years of research or analytical experience with other financial institutions
Strong Excel and analytical skills to collate and analyze a wide range of information
Strong network and understanding of the Australian and New Zealand capital markets
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Good organization skills and very high attention to details
Good time management and prioritization; managing priorities while maintaining high standards; and to work in a team.
Candidates with less experience can be considered as Research Assistant
About S&P Global Ratings
S&P Global Ratings is the world’s leading provider of independent credit ratings. Our ratings are essential to driving growth, providing transparency and helping educate market participants so they can make decisions with confidence. We have more than 1 million credit ratings outstanding on government, corporate, financial sector and structured finance entities and securities. We offer an independent view of the market built on a unique combination of broad perspective and local insight. We provide our opinions and research about relative credit risk; market participants gain independent information to help support the growth of transparent, liquid debt markets worldwide.
S&P Global Ratings is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence. For more information, visit www.spglobal.com/ratings
S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer committed to making all employment decisions without regard to race/ethnicity, gender, pregnancy, gender identity or expression, color, creed, religion, national origin, age, disability, marital status (including domestic partnerships and civil unions), sexual orientation, military veteran status, unemployment status, or other legally protected categories, subject to applicable law.']

title: ['Budget and Reporting Analyst']
description:
["
$86,558 to $98,210 (Plus Superannuation)
Ongoing
Usual hours of work: Full Time (flexibility may be available)
Usual work location: 1 Spring Street, Melbourne (flexibility may be available)

The position of Budget and Reporting Analyst forms a part of the Investment and Procurement Branch within the Corporate Services Group.
The Investment and Procurement Branch provides strategic advice and professional services to the business and our Ministers, creating value by improving performance and sustainability across the DJPR portfolios in line with its objectives.
The Budget and Reporting Analyst supports the implementation and uptake of the Oracle Cloud Financial System's Enterprise Performance Management Module (EMP) within the Department.
The Budget and Reporting Analyst will be responsible for building new management reports utilising EMP, developing and maintaining user guidance materials and providing tailored support and advice to end users to maximise benefits realised. The Budget and Reporting Analyst will also support the Manager EPM to review and enhance the EPM module and associated processes and policies, provide tools to enable informed decision making, and improve reporting and financial management capability across the department.
Reporting to the Manager, Enterprise Performance Management the key accountabilities of the role include:


Advance the implementation and uptake of the Enterprise Performance Management (EPM) module within the Department's Oracle Cloud System including by:
building new management reports utilising EMP;
developing and maintaining user guidance materials;
supporting the implementation of system updates.
Provide tailored support and advice to end users to maximise benefits realised from the EPM. Identify common issues and solutions and translate findings into new guidance materials, training and/or system refinements.
Support the Manager EPM to monitor the ongoing and emerging budgeting, reporting and forecasting requirements of the department and provide advice on the need for refinement of the EPM and/or department processes.
Demonstrate advanced financial expertise to routinely advise/explain complex concepts, ideas and issues to colleagues and managers.
Establish and maintain effective, strategic and collaborative relationships with stakeholders within the department in order to manage risks, resolve issues and drive improvement in budgeting, reporting and forecasting.

For a confidential discussion, please call Daniel Rodger, Director Strategy and Investment on 0428 039 561.
Successful candidates will be required to undergo a National Police Records Check prior to commencing employment with the Department
For further information on the position, please refer to the attached position description.
How to Apply
Please click the ‘Apply Now' button. As part of the application process, you will provide responses to the following two questions in your cover letter:


Give an example of how you've used your budgeting and financial analysis skills to either improve a process or financial system in order to facilitate budget and financial advice to management.
Please outline your experience in implementing a new system or process in the workplace; what approach did you take and how did you ensure acceptance from stakeholders.

Applications close at midnight on 2 December 2020"]

title: ['Strategy Analyst']
description:
["Energy Safe Victoria (ESV) is Victoria's safety regulator responsible for electricity, gas and pipeline safety. Our role is to ensure that Victorian gas and electricity industries are safe and meet community expectations. We are also responsible for licensing and registering electricians, and educating the community about energy safety. Our people come from a wide range of professions with diverse skills and experience driving the success of ESV.
About the opportunity
We have an exciting 6 month fixed-term opportunity reporting to the Head of Risk and Strategy, as the Strategy Analyst you will be responsible for reviewing, supporting and managing major project deliverables.This includes establishing a formal strategic planning process, including alignment with the Commission operating rhythm.


Assist the Head of Risk and Strategy to manage the annual strategy lifecycle to produce strategy drafts and ESV's annual Corporate Plan.
Assess strategy inputs and data analytical outputs to support the development of strategic options.
Facilitate, document, and coordinate workshops and processes with various key stakeholders to identify strategy inputs and positions.
Assist the Head of Risk and Strategy to design and establish a revised enterprise risk management approach.
Identify, analyse and maintain ESV's understanding of strategic risks.
Design and document elements of ESV's strategy lifecycle.

To be successful, you'll have:

Tertiary qualifications relevant to organisational strategy development.
Demonstrable experience working within organisational strategy lifecycle and processes.
Stakeholder engagement and coordination competencies.
Highly developed interpersonal and communication skills (written and verbal).
Ability to define strategic problems and identify solution options.
Strong project management skillsets to scope, design and deliver business requirements.
Highly developed organisational and coordination skills with attention to detail.

Why join us?
At Energy Safe Victoria we offer roles that enable our people to feel valued by making a meaningful contribution to the Victorian community. We pride ourselves on our collaborative and supportive culture, and support the skills and career development of our people through regular leaning, development and growth opportunities.
How to apply
Please refer to the available position description to assess your suitability and submit your current resume and cover letter via the Apply button. ESV will conduct relevant and required checks about applicants and the information provided with an application. Such checks will include but are not limited to:


ESV contacting current and previous employer(s) to substantiate employment history, past conduct and performance is required.
A satisfactory National Police Check will be required (for all non-ESV employees).

Please note that the location for this opportunity may temporarily be working from home due to the current requirements for all Victorians to practice social distancing amid the pandemic."]

title: ['Reporting Analyst – Melbourne']
description:
['Req Number: KFINT15750

Location: Melbourne, Victoria

Posted: 11/17/2020

Category: SOLUTIONS

Job Type: Temporary

About Us
At Korn Ferry we are passionate about what we do, the value we bring to our clients and the careers we provide our people. We pride ourselves on high quality execution, encourage a culture of ongoing career development and recognise performance and commitment.

As the global industry leader in high-impact recruitment solutions, we offer fully customised, flexible services to help our clients meet their talent and recruitment needs. Our focus on unlocking IP, relationships within the broader Korn Ferry group, the calibre of people and delivering excellence, help us to provide a compelling and competitive proposition.

Korn Ferry provides its employees with a truly global opportunity to work with the best clients, as well as the best tools, technologies and expertise in the industry.
About the role
We have an exciting opportunity for a Reporting Analyst to join our Westpac RPO team. This is a permanent opportunity based in Melbourne.

This role will be responsible for building and supporting reporting development for our Westpac RPO solution. The role will entail producing reports and dashboards by utilizing Tableau and Microsoft Excel.

This is an excellent opportunity for someone with a passion for gathering information from various sources and tools, transforming the information and building reports and dashboards and effectively presenting to key stakeholders. The role offers the opportunity to expand their knowledge and exposure within Korn Ferry, working our new RPO client, Westpac.
About You
To be successful in this role, you will enjoy collaborating with teams across the business to seek information. You will enjoy working within a busy, fast-paced environment and will be action-oriented with have high levels of motivation. If you’re an expert at multitasking, working to tight timeframes and enjoy taking accountability for your work, then you will thrive in this role. Equally, you will be someone who deals well with ambiguity, isn’t afraid to try new things and has a solution focus to problem solving.
In addition, you will have:

two years’ experience working in a hands-on data or reporting role, ideally in the HR or recruiting space;
development experience building dashboards and visualisation solutions (preferably with Tableau, Oracle Recruitment Cloud and/or Taleo);
experience of data modelling techniques;
extensive Excel skills;
ideally client facing data storytelling and presentation experience

Apply
If you have a passion for delivering a world class RPO solution and want to be part of an ever-growing team then we would love to hear from you.
If you currently work for Korn Ferry or one of our affiliates, you must be eligible to apply for a different position within Korn Ferry to use the Careers Site. If you accept such a position, your benefits programs and Human Resources policies may change. Please consult with your HR contact for the new position concerning application eligibility, benefit programs, and HR policies applicable to that position.']

title: ['Quantitative Analyst - QFS']
description:
['Date: 13-Nov-2020

Location:
Melbourne, VIC, AU

Department:Description:
Quantitative Finance Solutions (QFS)

Sitting under Deloitte’s Treasury and Capital Markets team, the QFS team helps businesses and financial institutions navigate complex financial risks. No two days are the same in our team as you might work on challenges related to financial instruments or risk management on one day and design ad hoc tools for clients on another.

About the role
We have an exciting opportunity for a talented tool developer with 1-2 years’ experience to join our QFS team in Sydney or Melbourne. In this role, we will leverage your knowledge and technical skills to understand client needs, design and develop ad hoc tools to provide better solutions to the client.

What will your typical day look like?

Design and develop complex and user-friendly models and tools independently
Collaborate with the team to overcome challenges and meet our commitments to the client
Manage stakeholder’s expectation, including communicating with and reporting to internal engagement management team and external stakeholders
Research and benchmark between options for an optimal solution

This is an excellent opportunity to join a team of intellectually curious and collaborative quantitative professionals. You will be mentored by senior staff members who are directly invested in your development and offer fast-tracked career for high performers – promotion is based on performance not on years of service.

Enough about us, let’s talk about you.

You are an intellectually curious professional with experience in providing solutions, machine learning, or user interface development. Any experience in financial services or treasury related field may be useful but isn’t essential. Your strong technical skills with solution design and development coupled with your investigative techniques, analytical and problem-solving mindset and holistic view will set you up for success in this role. In addition, you will require:

Bachelor or higher degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering/IT or a related field
Demonstrate knowledge of financial markets and financial instruments
Strong quantitative programming skills, including the capability to design and develop sophisticated applications for, such as, data extraction and visualisation, computation, machine learning / optimisation, predicative modelling.
Sound knowledge and experience of two or three programming languages include but not limited to C#, R, Python, MATLAB, SAS, SQL, JavaScript, PHP and VBA.
Sound knowledge and experience of one business intelligence software include but not limited to Power BI, Tableau and QlikView.
General knowledge of business processes, systems, operations and cycle controls and implications on the client and advisory process.

Why Deloitte?

At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. We value difference and embrace people with diverse backgrounds and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in different ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.']

title: ['Investment Analyst - Listed Assets']
description:
["Be inspired everyday

At HESTA we’re dedicated to people working in health and community services – a growing sector of ordinary people doing extraordinary things, day in day out, right across Australia.
More than 870,000 Australians trust HESTA with their money. So together, we invest billions of savings globally. We're about creating brighter futures for our members. And, a better world for generations to come. Our focus is on helping our members enjoy a retirement they’ve worked hard for.

The opportunity

Are you looking for a new challenge? We are on the lookout for high calibre talent as our Investments team is growing again! We have a fantastic opportunity for an Investment Analyst to join our team in Melbourne, someone who has a long horizon mind-set and commercial acumen. This role will focus on supporting the Investment Managers in the listed asset exposure, in particular, listed equities, currency, fixed interest and cash.

In this role, will have the opportunity to work across a multidisciplinary team assisting the Investment Managers with research and analysis to support the ongoing effective management of the portfolio to facilitate investment decisions that improve the expected risk and/or return profile of the portfolio.

We’re looking for someone with an aptitude and interest in qualitative and quantitative analytics with some experience in financial modelling, investment analytics, and risk analysis.
Having commenced your career in superannuation, funds management, asset consulting, or banking, experience in financial modelling and research including data management and coding will be highly regarded.

You will display strong written and verbal communications skills as well as proven analytical skills. You will be tertiary qualified in a relevant business degree and working towards a CFA/Master of Finance will be looked upon favourably.

What’s in it for you?
Access to great benefits, including a supportive environment, ongoing professional development, generous employer contributions and a market competitive total remuneration package
Be part of an ambitious, innovative and inclusive culture, whilst being coached and supported by experienced leaders who genuinely care about their team.
Opportunities to develop new skills and grow your career
Join one of the largest and fastest growing superannuation funds


HESTA is a great place to learn and grow your career. But don't just take our word for it, we were named (again!) Employer of Choice for Gender Equality 2020.
Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply."]

title: ['Operational Reporting Analyst']
description:
["Join Australia's fourth largest Telco in an exciting growth phase
Awesome employee benefits and a dynamic team environment!
Thrive in a company with a great working culture



Vocus is crazy about customers. We’re also crazy about our people. We empower them to Do it. Own it. Love it and that’s why they choose to work for us. Here, it’s never just a job – We care about the impact we have, and that’s what connects us. Whoever you are, you'll fit right into our team of 1500 personalities. And as you help us disrupt our industry, we’ll support you to be ‘the best you’, at Vocus and at home.

Whoever you are, you'll fit right into our team of 1,400 different personalities. We’ll support you to be the best you can be here at Vocus and at home.

What’s the opportunity?

This role has ownership of the management reporting capability conducting needs analysis, designing, developing and maintaining standardised management reports and dashboards. The role will also support both ad hoc and standardised reporting of Technology Operations performance into Vocus Networks and if needed, into Vocus Retail. The role will also be responsible for the building of an ‘Metrics & Insights’ capability that monitors Technology Operations activity in order to identify inefficiencies, opportunities for improvement and threats to optimising operational delivery.


What you’ll be doing:
Responsible for identifying existing reporting requirements, both adhoc and scheduled, for recipients from Technology Operations, Technology and other Vocus businesses.
Utilising existing source data drawn from disparate systems, design, develop and maintaining standard operational reports (eg: Monthly, Weekly reporting) across Service Operations, Field and Facilities, Systems & Infrastructure, Network Operations and Delivery Management
Create and manage dashboards to communicate complex information so that broader business has visibility and understanding of Technology Operations performance
Support the input of key technology operations data into Vocus Group businesses as needed
Lead the implementation of an ‘metrics & insights’ capability into technology operations utilising next generation data storage, processing, exploration, visualisation and prediction tools
Plan and assist in the implementation of operational optimisation initiatives or projects related to operational changes. Provide ongoing reporting of key metrics
Ensure maintenance of reporting security and integrity controls
Develop and undertake or contribute to research projects
Support the exploration of productising data analytics offerings to Vocus customers (especially wholesale service providers)
What we need from you:
1-3+ years of experience directly related to the role
Experience conducting end-to-end analysis that includes data gathering and requirements specification
Proven ability to architect, develop and automate BI and analytics solutions, iteratively build and prototype dashboards
Demonstrated experience in interpreting data/outcomes to highlight business problems, risks and opportunities
Experience in the Telecom industry or in industry that provides consulting and analytics/research services to clients to help them utilise the insights from our data and better execute their business needs
Design, test, and implement descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive studies using appropriate machine learning and data science techniques
Operational analytics experience
Strong knowledge of Power BI & SQL
Experience in business intelligence tools and reporting
Experience developing dashboards using Power BI, Tableau
Basic understanding of data models and predictive analytics.
Basic understanding of cloud based analytics and reporting - AWS and/or GCP preferred
It’s a seriously exciting time to join Vocus and there’s even more to come. If you think you want to join us and be part of something great, do it and apply now!

The extra stuff we know you want to know
We know how to celebrate our wins and we know learning from our mistakes makes us better. We are all about flexible working and, hand on heart, we practise work life balance. We high five you on your work anniversary and give you a day off. We know time off is important for balance, so we have an option to buy more leave. We embrace your unique style and let you be a master of your own style with no dress code. This is just the tip of the iceberg, so jump on our careers site or LinkedIn to find out more!

Did I hear you say, “Who is Vocus?”

We are a challenger business in the Telco and Energy Industry. We listened to our customers and heard that they wanted more from a network, so that’s what we’ve given them.
We built the network thanks to our own team of highly skilled fibre engineers.
We own our network giving us easier, straightforward access.
We manage our network here in Australia out of our Melbourne offices.
We now have more than 30,000 km of fibre optic cable laid and operational throughout Australia, 5000 on-net buildings connected to our network."]

title: ['Rating Analyst/ Research Assistant']
description:
['The Role: Research Assistant/Rating Analyst
The Location: Melbourne, Australia
The Role: You will be a critical member in the credit ratings team for the Infrastructure and Utilities Practice. You are responsible for supporting senior analysts in the Pacific (Australia and New Zealand) team in analyzing individual company’s financial performance, competitive industry placement and quality of management for analytical purposes. This analysis also includes sectors and market trends and comparisons to peers in Asia Pacific and globally. You will also be responsible for the development of spreadsheet statistics and databases and will be actively involved supporting senior analysts in the development of rating committee presentations, portfolio reviews and thought leadership aimed at investors and other financial market participants.
The Team / The Business: The Practice was established by S&P Global Ratings to expand our ratings franchise in an area of strong global growth and to leverage our significant infrastructure expertise across the full range of infrastructure asset classes. Globally, Practice team members reside in 24 locations and work on a diverse range of transactions applying different ratings criteria, predominantly corporate and project finance. We also work on transactions in partnership with other practices on a regular basis. Effective teamwork, strong written and verbal communication skills and a thoughtful approach to problem solving are highly valued.
Your skills: Bachelor degree is required. Rating Analysts will have in-depth knowledge of market updates in the financial and corporate industry. You have strong analytical and research skills. Candidates with less experience may be considered as a Research Assistant.
Responsibilities:
Collects economic and financial information specific to a relevant markets or organizations, conducts market sector or statistical analysis and interprets key market data elements into useful business information
Leverages broad scope of knowledge when performing analysis on data sets
Focuses on theory and concepts, applying quantitative or analytical skills to complete projects/studies/tasks
Conducts research including identifying data, data inputs, and statistical analysis of results and creates and maintains data and analysis reports
Works closely with senior analysts to ensure most recent information is updated in the financial model
Support senior analysts to prepares presentations and participate in meetings with clients
Requirements:
Bachelor degree in business, finance, accounting or related subjects
Pursuing CPA or CFA designation will be ideal
1 – 3 years of research or analytical experience with other financial institutions
Strong PowerPoint, Excel and analytical skills to collate and analyze a wide range of information
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Good organization skills and very high attention to details
Good time management and prioritization; managing priorities while maintaining high standards and strong ability to work as part of team
About S&P Global Ratings
S&P Global Ratings is the world’s leading provider of independent credit ratings. Our ratings are essential to driving growth, providing transparency and helping educate market participants so they can make decisions with confidence. We have more than 1 million credit ratings outstanding on government, corporate, financial sector and structured finance entities and securities. We offer an independent view of the market built on a unique combination of broad perspective and local insight. We provide our opinions and research about relative credit risk; market participants gain independent information to help support the growth of transparent, liquid debt markets worldwide.
S&P Global Ratings is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence. For more information, visit www.spglobal.com/ratings
S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer committed to making all employment decisions without regard to race/ethnicity, gender, pregnancy, gender identity or expression, color, creed, religion, national origin, age, disability, marital status (including domestic partnerships and civil unions), sexual orientation, military veteran status, unemployment status, or other legally protected categories, subject to applicable law.']

title: ['Data Analyst']
description:
['Data Analyst / Pricing Analyst / Insurance

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join a growing team for a leading insurance company based in the CBD. This is an amazing opportunity for a mid-level Data Analyst who is looking for that next step in their career. You will receive ongoing training and development and get to work with incredible people from the industry who are passionate about data.

The main purpose of the role is:
To deliver analytical insights from claims and policy data to support the business and the pricing function in particular
The development and provision of regular and ad-hoc BI reports on key business metrics
The provision of analytical tools that support the underwriting, pricing and risk functions
To fulfill the data and reporting requirements and obligations to third parties including Government agencies, actuaries, and reinsurers
To be responsible for making changes to the rates in the rating engine as well as facilitating enhancements to the rating engine functionality.
Key Responsibilities:
Undertake simple ad-hoc reporting/analysis tasks with the aim of providing insights and recommendations to the pricing function to drive business outcomes
Working with internal stakeholders to develop new BI reporting to enable the business to understand business performance at a more granular and deeper level as well as to assess the effectiveness of implemented business initiatives and strategies
The provision of regular standard data extracts for reserving and pricing including improvement of the data asset and acting as the key contact for Actuaries in respect of data meaning and usage
Have a good understanding of the pricing process, the Actuarial outputs, results and messaging and being able to explain the results to Executive
To act as the pricing liaison with ICT, particularly with regard to rating engine developments
Leading certain pricing projects, driving changes, and ensure they happen.
Streamlining and automating manual processes where possible, liaising with ICT as required.

Competencies:
Strong analytical, reporting, and problem-solving skills
Strong attention to detail - Methodical in the management of data, reports, tools, and presentations
Excellent presentation and communication skills – verbal and written
Self-motivated with the ability to work autonomously and within teams
Strong time and priority management capabilities
Highly competent with Excel, SAS, and dashboarding skills, Power BI or equivalent

Qualifications:
Numerical focused Bachelor’s degree - either Finance, Commerce, Mathematics or Statistics or similar
Experience in General Insurance is helpful but not mandatory
Ideally 2-3 years’ experience working in similar roles

This is an immediate need with a quick online interview process. Please click apply to submit your resume.']

title: ['Integrated Business Planning (IBP) Analyst']
description:
['Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team
NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world’s best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At NIKE, Inc. it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game.
Every successful team At NIKE, Inc. Inc. needs a brilliant game plan. Strategic Planning teams keep the company moving in the right direction by leading the strategic business planning process and spearheading transformational projects across Nike businesses and geographies. Embedded in teams across the company, strategy professionals explore complex business issues; conduct consumer, competitive and market analyses; create financial models and develop action plans. The Strategic Planning teams help write the future of sport by charting Nike’s path forward.
We are currently recruiting for the position of Integrated Business Planning (IBP) Analyst; this is a permanent position reporting into the Pacific IBP Manager.

WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR?
As Integrated Business Planning Analyst, you will become a part of an extensive cross-functional team driving overall financial, operational and marketplace performance for the Territory. You will support the Territory IBP offense that facilitates the IBP process by gathering information from a wide range of sources, analyzing and preparing stories relative to the operating plan and business monitoring. You will drive timely decisions and actions around risk & opportunities. Your cross functional partnerships will include but are not limited to teams from Demand & Supply Management, Integrated Marketplace, Finance, Nike Direct, Operations and Geo IBP.


WHAT WILL YOU WORK ON?
Integrated Business Planning strategy execution including but not limited to;

IBP CONSENSUS PLAN SUPPORT

Maintain a 6 season rolling integrated Consensus Plan forecast for PacificSupport execution of Monthly Consensus Operating Plan in accordance with the Integrated Business Planning Process (IBP Process) inclusive of Territory and Geo reporting by partnering with cross functional teams to ensure objectives, deliverables and outcomes are aligned and achievedOwnership of the forecast tool (Anaplan) and outputs. Partnership with APLA for successful tool enhancements and leverage the tool to facilitate robust discussions.
IBP ECOSYSTEM

Ensure a planning environment operates effectively to support sustainable, profitable growthFocus on feedback loops and integration of key assumptions throughout various cross functional forecast gatesElevate and track risks and opportunities through IBP Ecosystem.
BUSINESS MONITORING PROCESS SUPPORT

Schedule meetings and provide support for both local and Geo Executive/ Management IBP meetings through preparing agenda and deliverablesOwn cancels process, including reporting and alignment with Marketplace Financial Planning Managers on a monthly cadence. Align with APLA IP on long range cancel forecastsCollection of data and insights from cross functional managers for executed meetings and communication with related teams to ensure functional representationSupport IBP Manager on ad hoc analysis including cross functional scenario planning with focus on risks, opportunities and mitigation plansPositively contribute to achievement of agreed Pacific Big 5 KPI’sPromote excess inventory conversations and impacts to delivering the plan
WHAT YOU BRING TO NIKE

Bachelor degree in Business, Operations, Supply Chain, Finance or a related fieldAt least 2 years’ experience in relevant business environment, preferably a large organisationUnderstanding of broad operational, financial and marketplace conceptsBusiness analysis and quantitative skills to approach scenarios methodically with fact based insightsExcellent communication skills (written, verbal and presentations) influencing and collaborationAbility to foster strong relationships with Nike partners across functions both in Pacific and APLAProficient in MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint) with Tableau/Cognos experience favourable.
APPLICATION DEADLINE IS MONDAY 30th of NOVEMBER
NIKE, Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package, casual work environment, a diverse and inclusive culture, and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location, or the role, every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world.
NIKE, Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.']

title: ['Fraud Analyst']
description:
['About the role
Our Fraud Analysts identify and assess fraud risks associated with new products and processes across Latitude Financial Services as well as the identification of improvement opportunities related to fraud.
You will be responsible for;
Assist in identifying areas of in-efficiency in the fraud department and work with relevant teams to ensure that improvements are made.
Ensure that fraud processes and policies are adhered to and that adequate monitoring is in place to identify any potential anomalies, including systems governance and internal fraud
Review functional and business specifications to ensure that any systems/process changes that may lead to a fraud impact are communicated
Conducting timely and articulate assessments of fraud risk associated with new projects/processes ensuring that business is aware and prepared for any changes that may impact fraud.
What will you be doing?
You will be driving and facilitating the continued optimisation of Fraud Prevention Systems by way of Rule reviews, Trend analysis and Customer & Fraudster Profiling. This role will also see you provide targeted commentary of Fraud Loss and Prevention results both internally and externally.
Monitor and communicate volume and quality metrics for operational fraud teams ensuring an effective outcome for the business.
Interpret data outputs of confirmed Fraud Incidents and translate these into prevention strategies.
Assist in the forecasting of fraud exposure and losses.
Assist in the implementation and analysis of new Fraud Prevention products as they become available.
Drive the communication of new/improved system and process strategies to wider fraud department.
About you
You are an experienced analyst who is passionate and interested in the financial crime industry, you understands not only who the "bad-guys" are but who are awesome customers are and how to best look after them.
Demonstrable experience with SAS, SQL or equivalent coding experience eg: Python, R
Ability to work in a dynamic environment where priorities can change frequently.
Ability to maintain high standards of accuracy and work under pressure to achieve deadlines.
Sound like you?

That’s a good sign! In return for your energy and ideas we offer genuine flexible family life / work balance e.g. adjusted days, hours. Health, well-being and social initiatives to help you feel great and connected, as well as our hugely popular extra week of leave program.


We always support a safe, healthy, engaging and productive working environment for all employees and workers, whether that be in your home an office or a combination of both. We live and breathe our values. Act Right, Show Care, Be Curious


Partners in money

Latitude may seem like the new kid on the block, but it’s taken us almost a hundred years to become an overnight success. Digital payments, cards, loans and insurance is what we offer - but what we really are is a platform that helps people shop and live better.


Successful applicants will be required to complete a background check (including criminal history and bankruptcy check) prior to commencement of employment. Only open to Australian or New Zealand Permanent Residents or Citizens']

title: ["NAB 'Technology Intern Program' Feb 2021"]
description:
["At NAB, we believe success comes from our people. We're committed to supporting your learning and skills development throughout your career, as you help us build a culture that affects change for our customers - and for the community too.

We have countless opportunities at NAB to kick start your career. Through our strong partnerships with Australian Universities we provide great and rewarding placements for students with hands-on real-life projects that get delivered with your help and all prior to finishing your degree.

Be part of the NAB journey and join one of Australia’s largest Technology Internship programs!

title: ['EMR Analyst (Emergency)']
description:
["At Northern Health, we take care of the residents of Melbourne’s north, by providing a diverse range of health services, at Northern Hospital Epping, Broadmeadows Hospital, Craigieburn Centre and Bundoora Centre. We also collaborate with our partners to help expand the range of healthcare services offered to our culturally rich and diverse community.


Northern Health Electronic Medical Record (EMR) Project

Northern Health plans to implement an integrated Electronic Medical Record with the Vision ‘One patient’ ‘One integrated record’ and the purpose to optimise the quality and safety of our patient care. Northern Health is planning a full stack implementation to be in place by mid-2022 which will bring us to a level 5+ HIMSS EMRAM scale of EMR adoption. A large team will be hired and mobilised to plan and deliver a large scope of technical and clinical work to support the implementation and to ensure the achievement of timelines, once confirmed.

The program of work will transform how clinical care is provided to the patients and communities we serve and will be a clinically lead transformation project.

About the role:

The EMR analyst will be responsible for the analysis, design, build, configuration, testing and conversion of the EMR at Northern Health. You will be responsible for the review of existing workflows, content and configuration to contribute to the optimization of current workflows and the design of new workflows.

As an EMR analyst you will have strong clinical workflow knowledge and possess business analytic skills. You will have the ability to work autonomously and analyse clinical workflows, collect and review data in the data collection workbooks.
You will engage and facilitate agreement between Northern Health as to the design and configuration of the solution and will be responsible for facilitating system build, testing and assisting with development of training materials. You will manage all your deliverables to ensure timelines and objectives are met and work collaboratively with the EMR team, Department and clinical staff for all EMR matters.
Throughout the program you will facilitate regular communication with relevant stakeholders and staff, listening to an analyzing their needs and negotiating agreed outcomes. Together with program management staff, you will identify and manage program risks. Following go-live you will provide support to ensure a smooth transition for users. This role is required to commence in February 2021.


About you:
 A tertiary degree in healthcare, midwifery or science related field
 A clinical or other health related background of at least 3 years, with an interest in computerised workflows, best practise, innovation, clinical documentation and healthcare informatics
 Demonstrated experience working in a tertiary hospital environment and understanding of clinical workflows in the acute and subacute inpatient settings
 Knowledge of and experience with the Cerner EMR or equivalent EMR/Clinical systems implementations
 Critical thinking, strong analytical and troubleshooting skills to investigate and understand issues along with their clinical implications.
 Experience using common business analysis software such as Microsoft Visio and excel
 Excellent written and verbal communication skills, the ability to effectively communicate with stakeholders within the organisation with an eye for detail


We can offer:
 Health and Wellbeing programs, including our new ‘Thrive’ program
 Flexibility in the workplace and extra leave options and support
 An inclusive and culturally safe space
 Access to salary packaging, EAP, our online library and onsite car parking.


Next Steps . . .

If this opportunity sounds like the next step in your career, then we would love to hear from you. Please click on the 'Apply' button and follow the prompts. For further details, please refer to the PD and Recruitment & Information pack. Alternatively contact Ash Gaidhankar EMR PMO Manager via Ashish.Gaidhankar@nh.org.au


Work with us! Northern Health is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to attracting and retaining a diverse workforce which reflects the community we serve. Applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, as well as applicants who are LGBTIQ+, who have different abilities, or are from culturally and Linguistically Diverse Backgrounds are encouraged.


Selection Criteria Essential: A tertiary degree in healthcare, midwifery or science related field
Essential: A clinical or other health related background of at least 3 years, with an interest in computerised workflows, best practise, innovation, clinical documentation and healthcare informatics
Essential: Demonstrated experience working in a tertiary hospital environment and understanding of clinical workflows in the acute and subacute inpatient settings
Essential: Knowledge of and experience with the Cerner EMR or equivalent EMR/Clinical systems implementations"]

title: ['Business Analyst, Digital Mailroom']
description:
['
Full time maximum term position up to 12 months
Salary commensurate with experience, range: $91,334 - $114,165 plus superannuation
Attractive employee benefits including salary packaging

About the role: As an experienced Business Analyst you will work collaboratively with internal subject matter experts, stakeholders and managers to understand VLA business needs to enable the smooth transition to digital records management. You will analyse and document business requirements, and review existing services to enhance internal processes to improve effective service delivery across the organisation.
This is an excellent opportunity to join the digital transformation project, providing vital foundations to ensure we continue to provide effective services to clients whilst working remotely.
About you: You have extensive experience in business analysis methods with the analytical capability to understand our current processes and translate complex and diverse user needs into simple requests and technical specifications. You will be an innovative thinker who excels in developing fit for purpose solutions to meet organisational objectives.
Crucial to your success in this role will be your highly developed communication and negotiation skills, with the ability to influence and engage colleagues and stakeholders and drive organisational change.
About Victoria Legal Aid: Our vision is for a fair and just society where rights and responsibilities are upheld. With over 800 staff employed in 15 offices across Victoria, we help people with their legal problems by providing information, advice and education with a focus on the prevention and early resolution of legal problems. We also provide legal representation to those who need it most.
Employee benefits: We offer attractive employment benefits including salary packaging (making part of your salary tax-free), flexible working arrangements, family friendly policies and opportunities for professional development. Whilst the work is challenging, you will be rewarded with a culture that is focused on achieving quality outcomes for disadvantaged Victorians.
How to apply: Please submit a current resume and completed candidate application form (listed within the file attachments as a Word document). You must complete the candidate application form to be considered for this role, separate responses to the KSC outlined in the position description are not required. Please also include the contact details of two referees.
To protect your safety and the health and safety of our staff, interviews for this role will take place online. If shortlisted for an interview you will be provided with further information about the process.
For further information review the attached position description or contact Kate Smith, Manager, Data Governance on (03) 9280 3945.
No agency applications will be accepted.
Applications close by 11.59pm on Monday 23 November 2020.']

title: ['Product Support Analyst (6 month contract)']
description:
["The Product Support Analyst requires an individual who has experience in resolving highly technical complex client issues with great troubleshooting skills and ability to think outside the box. You possess technical knowledge, problem solving skills and experience in a helpdesk environment providing technical support to clients. In this position you will provide support for clients from all verticals (K12, Higher Education and Enterprise) who use D2L’s suite of eLearning web-based software.

HOW WILL I MAKE AN IMPACT?

Resolving specific client issues received by phone, email or assignment through call tracking system under tight time constraints
Identifying and solving site related issues
Identifying and correcting improperly configured installations
Timely logging of all support calls in call tracking system and escalation of problems where appropriate
Updating call tracking system with all appropriate details while providing timely customer updates on issues
Improving D2L product/tool design and efficiency by reviewing and providing feedback on functional specifications, technical specifications and submitting Feature Requests, Usability Issues and Bugs to Product Development
Developing support documents, FAQ's and Knowledge-Based Articles
Participating in special projects as required
Participating in shift and on-call support rotations

WHAT YOU'LL BRING TO THE ROLE:

Minimum of 2 years’ experience in a technical support or help desk role
Customer service, communication, listening and human relations skills are required in order to determine client needs, understand and relay information, build positive rapport, confidence and trust and participate as an effective team member
Attention to detail, organizational and time management skills are essential in order to accurately enter data, maintain records and focus on multiple priorities in a fast paced environment
Excellent verbal, written and communication skills to effectively partner with clients, customers and stakeholders of all levels
Strong analytical, problem solving, decision-making skills
Proven SQL experience writing queries for SQL Server
Familiarity with programing specifically XML, HTML/XHTML, JAVA, JavaScript, ASP and .NET
Working knowledge of Webservices, REST and IIS
Understanding of Network topography (Database, App, File Servers and load-balancing)
Experience supporting enterprise software applications
Basic knowledge authentication protocols (LDAP, SSO, Shibboleth)
Experience with Fiddler and other Browser-based Analytics and Reporting tools would be an asset
Experience with eLearning software and supporting a Learning Management System would be an asset.
Bilingual (English/French) is an asset

EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS:

Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Computer Science
ITIL V3 Foundation Certification an asset

WHY WE'RE AWESOME:
Flexible work hours
Collaborative work environment
Snacks and food trays!
Gymnasium on site"]

title: ['Integration Business Analyst']
description:
['Introduction:
Opportunity for new/near Graduate or someone wishing to use their data analytics skills.
Utilise your talent in data to improve reporting and influence business decisions
Permanent Full time opportunity

Beyond Bank Australia is one of Australia’s largest customer owned banks with a long and proud history of success, credibility and banking expertise. With branches across the nation, and employing more than 600 staff, Beyond Bank Australia creates financial wellbeing for individuals, families, businesses and communities.

Working with key stakeholders from across the business, as a data analyst you will build, produce, review and analyse regulatory and internal reports.

Description:
Your key responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:


Assist with the development and maintenance of our RegTech reporting solution – to populate regulatory reports and forms.
Produce, reconcile and analyse data to be included in Regulatory reports with the highest degree of accuracy and timeliness.
Maintain documented end to end procedures related to regulatory reporting.
Build and maintain knowledge of regulatory reporting data requirements, including changes to those requirements over time or as a result of changes in our business operations
Produce, reconcile and analyse data to be included to be included in internal reporting
Assist with data governance by proactively identifying and investigating data quality issues or processes behind data collection to ensure the integrity of all regulatory reporting. Work with other areas of the business to correct and improve the quality of data.
Build and maintain sound overall knowledge of source data systems including core banking systems, CRM and loans origination systems to facilitate data gathering, analysis and reporting.
Foster and maintain positive relationships across the business and partner with other areas of the business to deliver quality outcomes.

Skills and Experiences:
In your first 6 months you will:

Assist in the transfer of legacy regulatory reporting systems (predominantly excel based) to our new RegTech reporting system.
Documenting procedures relating to those changes in regulatory reporting processes
Assist with the production of monthly and quarterly regulatory reports.

You will possess the following skills and experience:

Sound Excel skills and ability to develop those skills further;
Experience and/or skills in data transformation and data analytics required.
Accuracy and attention to detail in all work, persistence, skill and resilience in reviewing data and reporting for accuracy.
Strong workflow and time management skills, and ability to work with key stakeholders across the business to meet strict regulatory and internal reporting deadlines.
Experience in one or more of the following would be also be of benefit: the banking industry; financial or regulatory reporting;
Analytical and problem-solving ability
Effective writing and presentation skills
High degree of integrity and confidentiality

Here at Beyond Bank Australia we set you up for success by offering a workplace full of opportunities to further develop your career, as well as the flexibility to balance work, life and family.

Beyond Bank is an equal opportunity employer with a commitment to diversity at all levels.

As a certified B Corp we are using our business as a force for good.

Applications close COB Tuesday 24 November

For more information visit beyondbank.com.au']

title: ['Business Analyst']
description:
['The team

is responsible for providing professional services to address business objectives in the areas of risk prevention and fraud detection. To offer state-of-the-art software solutions and provide comprehensive client delivery and consulting support using our expertise and flexible, client-focused approach.

The role

The role will involve understanding and building business knowledge of the existing GBG products. A key part of the role will be ensuring our solutions are delivered to high standards of innovation, quality and excellence that delight our customers.

What you will do

Work closely with our clients to deliver world class fraud and risk GBG solutions.
This may consist of responding to customer queries, providing consultancy on correct usage of the system and fraud strategies, liaising with different business and technical teams for issue follow up, identifying and suggesting best practice improvements.

Configuration, training and documentation

Work closely with our clients and internal team members to document business requirements, specification documents, provide product training and to configure business related rules and other solution functionality.
This may also consist of responding to customer queries with business answers with minimum technical language.


To be successful, we are looking for

Skills:

Demonstrated experience in business analysis in an Information Technology environment with experience in Fraud detection, AML and Compliance.

Ability to analyse and interpret business scenarios and/or data, with the ability to identify business and functional requirements
Proactive attitude to the identification of solutions to address customer requirements and win – win solution
The ability to effectively facilitate work sessions with technical project teams and business stakeholders
Strong organizational and time management skills
Knowledge in relational databases with TSQL knowledge is an advantage.
Must be able to work on/manage multiple tasks concurrently
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English is essential
Exceptional attention to detail
Act as a role model and provide guidance and training where required for other team members.
Self-managed and proactive, comfortable working in an environment with constant changing of priorities and tasks


Behaviours

Analyzing and interpreting
Creating and conceptualizing
Adapting and coping

Additionally

Ability to work from home
Flexible with traveling']

title: ['Analyst']
description:
["Requisition Title -
Analyst
Job Number: - AUS121172
Description


First a bit about ANZ
At ANZ, everything we do boils down to ‘why’ – our purpose– to shape a world where people and communities thrive. We're just as focused on seeing our people thrive as well as our customers. We'll give you every opportunity to develop your career.

We are responding faster to changing customer requirements, focusing on the things that matter the most, energising our people, eliminating waste and reducing bureaucracy.

Your Mission?
Working within our Institutional Technology division that focuses on Digital, Data and Transaction Banking, you will be joining a team dedicated to building a world class Digital bank for corporate and institutional clients focusing on an omni channel customer experience, advanced customer analytics and insights, centralised registration management and digital identity solutions.

As an Analyst, you will work to deeply understand the business environment to refine requirements to increase the quality and efficiency of the customer outcome being delivered by the Squad and ensure the stability of systems.

What will you bring to the Digital, Data and Transaction Banking team?
Demonstrated experience working in one or more Analyst roles previously, e.g. Process Analyst, System Analyst, Business Analyst, Data Analyst, Operations Analyst

Deep domain and system knowledge to turn customer needs into business requirements and workable technology outcomes

Ability and willingness to collaborate and problem solve with your fellow Squad members to uncover dependencies and validate boundaries and sequencing of User Stories

Enjoy participating in and fostering a culture that encourages best practice around reviews, quality and documentation

Passion for identifying continuous improvement opportunities and implementing solutions to perform more effective and efficient analysis

Experience in translating requirements into user stories and acceptance criteria

A desire to continuously learn new techniques/ technologies and bring innovative ideas into the Squad

Broad understanding of how to apply Agile methodologies to your role

Experience working with Jira and Confluence would be an advantage

Strong communication and presentation skills
Please note this role is based in Melbourne.


At ANZ we aim to create an inclusive environment where employee differences such as gender, age, culture, disability, sexual orientation, family and caring responsibilities and religion are valued.

We work flexibly at ANZ. Talk to us and let us know how this role can be flexible for you."]

title: ['Business Analyst - IT']
description:
["Multiplex is a premier, global construction company, shaping skylines and delivering iconic projects for over 55 years.
We are at our best bringing large-scale and complex structures to life, and we have construction expertise across the entire property sector. Our work to date of current and completed projects comprises more than 1000 jobs with a combined value of more than $85 billion, and the financial strength and global relationships of our parent company Brookfield continues to drive our growth today.

Building our Talent
In this role as Business Analyst within Multiplex, you will act as an intermediary between the business and IT, drawing on a strong understanding of business processes and technology to ensure that the desired business outcomes are achieved.
What makes this role a unique BA role is that you will be part of Engagement and responsible for the ‘front end' collection of data and the body of work will then be completed by Delivery BA's within our business as part of the PMO. As the successful BA, you will be working with the business to help shape an application ‘Road Map' for the business units – truly understanding the customer and business strategy. This will then be communicated to the IT strategy & architecture team to ensure alignment with IT or IT's need to align to the business direction.
Our Business Engagement team work with the relevant business units to maximise the value they are able to derive from the services provided by Technology. You will be an advocate for them and play a key role in early solution shaping.

Key Accountabilities:

Identify new opportunities based on business unit requirements, and advise on how IT can contribute to business unit competitive advantage
Engage with architecture team on initiatives to ensure alignment with the IT strategy direction.
Partner with stakeholder teams across business units to develop and review documentation in a collaborative way, communicating effectively and leaning towards cost effective solutions and systems
Drive pre-project work such as feasibility assessment, scoping, requirements definition, business case and other related activities, working in conjunction with other parts of the business and IT to maintain engagement and manage expectations
Conducting service level reviews with both IT and business unit to determine emerging requirements and areas of improvement
Provide clear feedback to product and delivery teams on potential changes/improvements where applicable

Key Skillset Required:

Solid and proven experience working as a Business Analyst within a similar environment
Extensive experience of leading multi-stream programmes in complex, multiple stakeholder, matrix managed technology environments
Exceptional leadership skills, with the ability to develop and communicate the program objectives, inspire and motivate staff, and maintain alignment with business objectives
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to explain and promote the program goals and objectives to the business, as well as technical leadership
Strong business acumen, including industry- and domain-specific knowledge of the organisation and its departments
Excellent interpersonal skills focused on collaboration and building relationships within diverse teams across the organisation
Proven influencing and negotiation experience across a range of stakeholders. The ability to vary styles of interaction to match the needs of various stakeholders
Excellent analytical, strategic planning and execution skills
Ability to develop programs and deliver them within financial and resource constraints
Ability to perform well within ambiguity and tell a clear story using data and insights
Experience of multiple project/program management methodologies, such as PRINCE2, Agile, Scrum, Kanban
Knowledge of project planning tools, such as Microsoft Project, with evidence of practical application
Deep understanding of current and emerging technologies. Familiarity with industry trends and innovation
Ability and willingness to work flexible hours with teams across various global locations and time zones
Bachelor's degree in any field
Broad IT domain experience in three or more of the following areas: Applications Development, Enterprise Architecture, Project Management, Vendor Management, Quality Assurance, Infrastructure, and Maintenance and Support

Why join Multiplex?
Our business is built on our people. People who are impactful thinkers that seek rewarding partnerships with others and thrive in a culture of empowerment.
Our people love exceeding expectations and enjoy a supportive environment and plenty of opportunity which enables everyone to flourish. We have an experienced team of people intent on turning problems into opportunities and tackling projects that others say can't be done. Our innovative spirit has driven us for more than 55 years and made us a business that our people are proud of.

Diversity & Inclusion
At Multiplex we are committed to a diverse, inclusive and respectful workforce. We strongly encourage applications from people of all genders and walks of life. We offer flexibility in how our people work and value the ongoing development of all staff. We have competitive parental leave policies and have a variety of employee benefits.

Please note: this role is being sourced through Multiplex directly and we will not accept applications via external recruitment agencies"]

title: ['Supply Market Analyst']
description:
["Business Unit:
Procure & Business Planning
Function:
Business Services
Job Code:
703409

Supply Market Analyst


Your journey starts here
Career and lifestyle
Free myki travel


If you want a corporate career combined with lifestyle then V/Line can take you there. title: ['Digital Fraud Analyst']
description:
["Requisition Title -
Digital Fraud Analyst
Job Number: - AUS121900
Description

Opportunity to join the Fraud Analytics team
Work together with stakeholders across the business to protect our customers against fraud and minimise ANZ’s fraud losses
Career progressing opportunity
About The Role
Role Location: 833 Collins Street, Docklands VIC 3008
Role Type: Permanent, Fulltime opportunity
Your role as a Digital Fraud Analyst involves using data to think outside the box to protect ANZ’s customers from fraud and scam transactions.
Your key responsibilities will involve the use of data analytics to identify and detect fraudsters, as well as the creation of prevention rules within our fraud software. There is also an element of communication required, as you will need to explain current fraud trends to team-members and to external stakeholders. This knowledge sharing includes reporting and presentations.
In a fast paced role, where mere hours can make the difference between a major loss and a near miss, we are looking for someone who is excited by challenge. Join our supportive and collaborative team to use analytics to protect our customers.
About You
To be successful in this role, you will ideally bring the following -
Three to five years in a role that utilizes analytics and an understanding of converting data to insights
A puzzle-solving mindset
Proven experience using SAS/SQL in prior or current role
Experience with Data mining and Analysis of large datasets & reporting
Strong experience working in the Fraud or Digital security area; or demonstrated close coordination with Fraud teams
Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively with internal & external stakeholders and peers
Ability to manage multiple priorities and support quick decision making
About ANZ
At ANZ, everything we do boils down to ‘why’ – our purpose – to shape a world where people and communities thrive. We're just as focused on seeing our people thrive as well as our customers. We'll give you every opportunity to develop your career.
We are responding faster to changing customer requirements, focusing on the things that matter the most, energising our people, eliminating waste and reducing bureaucracy.
A happy workplace is a thriving one. So in order to attract and keep the best talent, and say thanks for the hard work, we make sure all our employees are rewarded.
ANZ recognises the value of an inclusive and diverse work environment. We take pride in the diversity of our people and encourage applications from diverse candidates. Our recruitment decisions are based on the key inherent needs and requirements of each role, and candidates are selected based on their unique strengths and characteristics.
We work flexibly at ANZ. Talk to us and let us know how this role can be flexible for you.

To find out more about working at ANZ or to view other opportunities visit www.anz.com/careers. You may apply for this role by visiting ANZ Careers and search for reference number Taleo Job Code (AUS121900).
#GD4.4"]

title: ['Graduate Business Consultant/Data Analyst']
description:
['Ideal for a graduate with strong analytical skills
Work closely with the co-founder and previous graduate hires
Training and mentorship from experience professionals


About the Client

Our client is a specialist Licensing business. Their team is made up of ex Oracle, SAP & IBM vice presidents, senior directors, former Oracle licence auditors, contracting professionals and business analysist. They assist clients in optimising their Licence footprint and maintaining visibility of their compliance position. They have extensive local and international experience working with clients in the selection and adoption of on-premise and cloud-based platforms. They advises clients on best practices, adoption, business case development and which licensing models to adopt. Our in-depth knowledge of the Oracle, SAP & IBM pricing, policies and solution sets enables our clients to extract maximum value from their platforms, fully leveraging their technology investments.

Duties

Our client is looking for a graduate to join their fast expanding realm of Software Asset Management. The successful candidate will;
Interpreting data, analysing results using statistical techniques relevant to Software Asset Management across multiple vendors.
Developing and implementing data analyses, data collection systems and other strategies that optimise statistical efficiency and quality.
Acquiring data from primary or secondary data sources and maintaining databases/data systems.
Researching customer requirements and provide ongoing reports
