title: ['Data Engineer']
description:
["Requisition Title -
Data Engineer
Job Number: - AUS122005
Description

Data Engineer – Deposits Tribe
At ANZ, everything we do boils down to ‘why’ – our purpose – to shape a world where people and communities thrive. We're just as focused on seeing our people thrive as well as our customers. We'll give you every opportunity to develop your career. We are responding faster to changing customer requirements, focusing on the things that matter the most, energising our people, eliminating waste and reducing bureaucracy.
ANZ has moved to a new way of working, leveraging agile practices. To understand more about this new way of working and if this role is right for you, we strongly encourage you to take a look at The ANZ Way vimeo channel where you’ll find ‘The ANZ Way’ animation and the ‘New Ways of Working’ animation.
We’ve also got some great information about what it’s like to work in ‘Data@ANZ’ on our LinkedIn Life page.
The Role
We have a Data Engineer role available within the Deposits Tribe.
The Deposits Tribe are responsible for the end to end management of ANZ’s transaction and savings customers and products. Our mission is to help our customers achieve their goals by providing the right solutions when it comes to how they want to save, use and manage their money. The ANZ Deposits Tribe is known for its great culture of collaboration, delivery, high performance and fun, supported by an approachable and inspiring leadership team. In joining this Tribe, you will be working a group of highly engaged, diverse and interesting people.
Data Engineers design next-generation data stores and analytic assets, and shape data to help solve complex problems and generate sophisticated insights. They work across multiple technologies and data platforms to optimise the ease and speed of delivering value from data.
As a Data Engineer with a remediation and compliance focus area, you will play a crucial role in uplifting the data capability, availability, governance, infrastructure and tooling for our squads in this area. You will help our Data Analysts to deliver tangible business and customer outcomes at high speed, with great accuracy and consistency. You will also help the Data Chapter to define & deliver the Deposits Data Roadmap.
What might a day in the life look like?
Design and deliver capability improvements to uplift the governance, quality and availability of data, standards and controls
Engineer/prototype/industrialise scalable data assets and platforms needed for analytics
Have a clear understanding of the end-to-end analytics journey as well as the ability to support the delivery of the Deposits Data Roadmap
Implement batch and streaming data pipelines, processes and patterns to integrate with existing and new data sources
Source, combine, transform and synthesise data across a variety of platforms
Define and conduct tests to validate that data is fit for purpose and that remediation calculations are correct and accurate

What you bring to the role
Experience in data pipelines, patterns, frameworks, tools and technologies and their use in business contexts
Experience working with both legacy and modern, on & off premise platforms and technologies
Expert in preparing and combining data using SQL, SAS, Python and/or R
Data governance, quality & control skills and experience
Process automation, continuous deployment and integration/data test automation capabilities
Ability to effectively communicate to all stakeholders (technical and non-technical)

Things that I am (or strive to be!)
A team player
The customer’s biggest fan
A collaboration champion
Comfortable being uncomfortable
Continuous improvement junkie
Committed to my own and other’s growth
A problem solver
Commercially and tech curious
Risk savvy
The role will report to a Data Engineering Chapter Lead within the Deposits Tribe.
#G.D4.3"]

title: ['Betting Analyst']
description:
["About us
Harness Racing Victoria (HRV), a statutory body, is responsible for the control, development, and promotion of the Victorian harness racing industry. With strong links to rural and regional communities, we are committed to developing a vibrant and sustainable harness racing industry which promotes participation, integrity, and racing excellence.
The Opportunity
It is a rare opportunity to join the Harness Racing Victoria's Integrity Unit in this newly created role and contribute to upholding the integrity of the sport.
The primary purpose of this role is to collate and provide technical advice relating to wagering and form analysis to ensure the integrity of harness racing in Victoria is maintained.

The key responsibilities of this role include:

Monitoring of market movements and daily wagering activities on Victorian harness races which include telephone betting, recordings, betting exchanges, pari-mutuel, and corporate bookmakers to develop profiles and patterns of behaviours.
Report suspicious betting activity to Stewards at race meetings in real time
Provide advice to the Integrity Department on wagering market anomalies/that may require further investigation
Conduct investigations into betting irregularities as required
Provide forensic research on betting information, identifying significant transactions, potential links to industry participants and similarities including regular or irregular betting patterns.
Produce clear and concise intelligence reports
Assist in the maintenance and development of manuals and process documents to ensure they are current and reflect Integrity Department objectives

About You
Ideally, we are seeking an applicant who meets the following key criteria:


Demonstrated analytical skills, especially in the collation and interrogation of data and report writing
Understanding of the Australian Harness Racing Rules in relation to betting obligations
Established and extensive understanding of Betting and their application to the racing industry
Proven working knowledge of Bookmaker operations and betting systems
Demonstrated problem solving and analytical skills, especially in the collation and interrogation of wagering and form data report writing
Proven high level communication and interpersonal skills to enable interaction with a diverse range of key stakeholders
Competence in using analytical software, use of major Microsoft applications including Microsoft Excel (spread sheet creation and the use of formulas and functions) and the ability to maintain and databases
Knowledge of the Racing and Gaming Acts
Demonstrated intermediate knowledge of web analytics
Demonstrated ability to diagnose, analyse, conceptualise and problem solve complex issues and recommend solutions
Excellent written and oral communication skills. Able to present information in a logical and clear manner.

Benefits
HRV is committed to providing a flexible and inclusive work culture that values and supports diversity and inclusion. We offer great benefits to our staff including:


Flexible working arrangements
Employee Assistance Program
Social Club
Discounted Health Insurance
Flu Vaccinations

The successful applicant will be required to successfully complete background checks in accordance with company policy.
Applications close 24 November 2020
No agencies please."]

title: ['Data Analyst']
description:
["6 month contract with a view to convert to a permanent role
Immediate start
Supportive team and leaders


About the Role

Immediate start for a Data Analyst with Power BI experience. This is a junior to mid-level position that will oversee the delivery of timely analytical capability across both Power BI and providing support in collating financial reports from multiple sites.

This is initially a 6 month contract position with a view to convert to a permanent role.

What skills will you need to be successful?
Strong knowledge of Power BI queries and development requirements.
Experience in data visualisations, analysis and manipulation, forecasting, business performance analysis and report enhancements
Ability to articulate highly technical concepts and insights, in a way that can be understood by stakeholders of varying degrees of technical literacy.
Background in data warehouse design and data mining.
Highly proficient in data preparation and integration.
Proficient in Microsoft PowerPoint and Excel.
Knowledge of Cloud environments is desirable, including Google, AWS, and Azure.
Ideal experience within retail or the FMCG space.
Detail focus and accuracy in all levels of work
As well as the above you will have a proactive nature with great communication skills.

Apply ASAP so you don't miss out on the opportunity. For a confidential conversation please get in contact with Caroline Evans at cevans@sharpandcarter.com.au or 0411816008."]

title: ['Customer Service Analyst']
description:
['Aesop has carefully cultivated a work environment in which our employees are constantly challenged to do their best. Our company is determinedly creative, intelligent and progressive, and nurtures these qualities by employing people who share our passionate interest in design, innovation, and incisive enquiry across all fields.

Our organisational culture is entirely unique, distinguished by an uncommon blend of courtesy, cordiality and intellectual energy. We seek those who can bring a wealth of life experience and inspired ideas to our table.

In return, we provide comprehensive induction and training programmes, and encourage an inclusive culture that nurtures enduring professional relationships. We also appreciate the benefits that flow from our employees’ external pursuits.

We raise our bar high at Aesop and never lower it; this is one of the keys to our success and one of the many reasons why people wish to work here. If you would like to join Aesop, we invite you to peruse our current career opportunities.
Purpose of the role
We are seeking a driven and ambitious Customer Service Analyst to join us full - time in our growing Global Customer team. This new and exciting role will report to the Global Customer Communication Manager and whilst this role will commence from home, our Global Head Office is based in Collingwood.
The Customer Service Analyst is accountable and responsible for the creation and constant improvement of data analysis and insight through Aesop ’s customer service channels gl obally. This covers both quantitative and qualitative data to create powerful and actionable insights from customer service channels that can be used across the business.
This role partners with the Regional Ecommerce Managers, Regional Customer Service Managers, Marketing, Digital and Customer teams to provide regular reporting and longer term, strategic insight to support decision making as a result of good data understanding and use .
What we are looking for
As an experienced Analyst or similar, you’ll have experience linking data from multiple data sources into a single, concise, value - add suit of reports , as well as experience deliver ing analysis and insight on commercial performance, productivity and customer insight to the business . ideally on a global, regional and individual level !
More specifically;
A t ertiary degree in Business / Commerce, engineering, science or other relevant subject
2-3 year s’ experience in a role as an analyst or in a role with similar capacity
Highly skilled user of excel
Experience with Ta bleau or similar reporting tools (e.g. PowerBi )
Experience with Google Analytics
Experience with SQL
Experience with Zendesk is preferred but not required
Proven ability to build relationships with a variety of stakeholder s
Most of all, a curiosity and desire to develop and grow with an entrepreneurial, global business.
Aesop proactively seeks out astute, creative, passionate individuals who think laterally and are capable of delivering work of the highest standard. If this sounds like something you may be interested in, apply now as we would love to hear from you!']

title: ['Business Analyst']
description:
['The speed of change is throwing traditional business methods into question and disrupting the relevance of entire industries. Capgemini, a global leader in consulting, digital transformation, technology and engineering services, is at the forefront of innovation and well placed to address opportunities for our clients in the evolving world of cloud, digital and platforms. Building on its strong 50-year heritage and deep industry-specific expertise, Capgemini enables organisations to realise their business ambitions through an array of services from strategy to operations. Capgemini is driven by the conviction that the business value of technology comes from and through people. Today, it is a multicultural company with over 270,000 team members in almost 50 countries. With Altran, the Group reported 2019 combined revenues of EUR 17 billion. Learn more about us at www.capgemini.com.

Let's talk about the team:
At Capgemini we are proud of our diverse team of professionals providing the right expertise to our clients in all aspects of the projects we deliver. We work with an impressive range of clients globally to assist them in delivering their business outcomes with an emphasis on innovation and progressive technology.

Let's talk about the role and responsibilities:

Conducting a detailed business analysis, outlining problems, opportunities and solutions for a business.
Understanding the life cycle of various processes within business and support teams and performing an impact analysis on various systems, data and processes involved.
Modelling business processes and identifying opportunities for process improvements.
Creating process documents for newly implemented process and conducting a training session for operational users.
Running the support data processes for Support teams and identifying opportunities for process improvements.
Managing and maintaining reporting dashboards for various business processes, presenting the dashboards to key stakeholders.
Supporting business transition and helping to establish change.
Support business team's data requirements in their business initiatives.
Understanding end-to-end processes, while performing specific support tasks.

Let's talk about your qualifications and experience:

5+ years experience in the Banking & Finance industry and/or compliance projects
Experience across enterprise delivery, release process, risk engagement, change management etc
Experience with the Atlassian suite (Jira + Confluence)
Business process and work instructions documentation experience
Effective Stakeholder Management, Critical Thinking, Problem Solving, Decision Making, Documentation & Writing Skills, Confident Presenter
Experience writing user stories, defining acceptance criteria and working closely with engineers and testers to ensure a quality outcome

Let's talk about what's in it for you!
Passionate people are Capgemini's Ace of Spades - join us to discover a career that will challenge, support and inspire you. Working at Capgemini you'll find the rewards are more than just financial. You will work alongside some very smart and inspiring people on exciting projects and you will also enjoy incredible benefits. We offer flexible work practices and 40 hours of self-development every year with a huge selection of learning opportunities to choose from.
As "Architects of Positive Futures", Capgemini actively supports the community in 3 ways:
Diversity and Inclusion - we believe diversity of thought fuels excellence and innovation, which is why we positively encourage applications from suitably qualified candidates regardless of their gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, religion, ability, intersex status or age. To support our commitment to diversity and inclusion, we celebrate special events and days of significance that are important to our employees such as Diwali, Bastille Day, Pride, IDAHOBIT, IWD and International day of people with Disabilities. Our Employee Resource Groups Women@Capgemini and OutFront support the grassroots passion of employees to drive our diversity agenda and effect change.
Digital inclusion - at Capgemini we are using our skills to drive social impact initiatives focusing on helping society address the impact of the digital and automation revolution. We also provide employees with opportunities to give back to the community through charity projects and volunteer days.
Environmental Sustainability - Capgemini joined the CDP's (Carbon Disclosure Project) prestigious "A list" for its commitment to the Net-Zero economy. We are focusing on helping our clients transform towards more sustainable business models and committing to reduce our own carbon emissions (GHG) by 20% per employee by 2020.
Recognised by Ethisphere as one of the World's Most Ethical Companies for the last 8 years in a row, ethics and values are at the heart of Capgemini's corporate culture and business. Embedded in our DNA, our seven values - Honesty, Boldness, Trust, Team Spirit, Freedom, Fun and Modesty - have remained the same since company inception in 1967. To see how we bring these values to life, click here to listen to some of our employee's stories.
Come join us, bring your whole self to work, create new possibilities for you, your customers and your community and help us to be Architects of Positive Futures.

Please note unsolicited resumes from employment agencies or other third parties will not be considered.
#LI-SR1']

title: ['Data Scientist']
description:
["Hey there, we’re PEXA!

We started as an idea: to deliver a single, national e-Conveyancing solution. We collaborated with the industry to create a national electronic lodgement and settlement platform: PEXA. From our humble beginnings, we’ve now grown to more than 320 employees across 5 different states. We’re still expanding at a rapid rate and constantly challenging ourselves to create great experiences for our members as they transition to fully digital conveyancing.

Why become a PEXArian?

Great question! Being a PEXArian is so much more than just a job. We are passionate, motivated & unashamedly enthusiastic at PEXA - we love what we do and we’re proud to admit it! Creating brilliant member experiences wouldn’t be possible if we didn’t also strive to create an amazing employee experience. Alongside our members, our employees are at the heart of everything we do.
Here’s a snapshot of what your life at PEXA could look like:

Your growth:
We encourage you to hit your personal and professional Learning & Development goals with our tailored programs and tools.

Your wellness:
We care about your holistic well being - a fully stocked kitchen, four wellness days, a $250 wellness subsidy as well as lunch and learn sessions to support your financial well being.

Your work/life blend:
We know that work is just one aspect of your life, we want to help you create your ideal work/life blend, rather than squeezing in life around work.

Your family:
With a range of benefits aimed at supporting your family including access to a subsidised school holiday program, extended parental leave and flexi-time to support your return to work, superannuation payments for unpaid parental leave for primary carers and a childcare allowance for pre-primary aged children, when we say, ‘welcome to the family’, we really mean it!
The impact you'd drive:
The Data Scientist will be responsible for the identification, cleansing, manipulation and modelling of data to contribute to the development of data new and existing products. They will contribute to our ambition to develop a best in class data science platform leveraging next generation technologies and collaborate with product, data and technology to develop working solutions in line with business strategy.
Proactively investigate and analyse property data using strong modelling skills.
Contribute to our ambition to develop a best in class data science platform leveraging next generation technologies.
Collaborate with product, data and technology to develop working solutions in line with business strategy.
Data gathering, analysis and modelling as required by the business
On day one we’d love you to have:
Strong analytical, statistical and modelling skills, with experience manipulating and 'making sense' of data from disparate systems.
Proven experience in creating measurable business value through data science.
Excellent SQL and SAS programming skills.
Proven experience with a programming language like Python, Java, R, SAS and C++.
Proven experience with ETL automating processes.
Proven experience with cloud based data storage.
Sounds like you?
If this role sounds like you, apply today to have your application reviewed ASAP!"]

title: ['Senior Analyst - Data Scientist']
description:
["Date: 19-Nov-2020

Location:
Melbourne, VIC, AU

Department:Description:
About our team

The A&A Analytic Solutions team is at the heart of the Audit & Assurance Digital Strategy across Deloitte Asia Pacific. Our team of data technologists (Artificial Intelligence / Machine Learning / Deep Learning), designers, developers and management consultants coupled with our proprietary data platform powers the next generation offerings helping clients make better data-driven decisions. We're absolute data nerds and love working with numbers and large data sets (the more unstructured, the better). Data brings us together; our difference inspires creativity and our focus on culture is our adhesive!

We believe that success comes from fully understanding the impact of choices and using a data driven approach drives improved operational and strategic decision making. Our team brings diverse thinkers from multiple disciplines to work together in a dynamic, fast paced and creative environment. We thrive on challenges enabled by our diverse portfolio, promote curiosity and continuous learning, all whist providing a supportive and inclusive team culture.

What will your typical day look like?

Advising clients to help solve real-life business problems across diverse industries through use of data, cloud, analytics and AI technologies;
Performing “hands on” statistical and machine learning modelling, computations, and data engineering to deliver best-of-breed analytical solutions to meet the need of the problem space;
Aiding in solution development from design through to production;
Involvement in identifying trends and innovation in deep learning, machine learning and related technologies to inform the future development of solutions for our clients.

Enough about us let's talk about you. You’re someone with…

Strong track record in understanding business problems and implementing analytical solutions to solve them with extensive experience in explaining complex technical concepts in simple terms.
3 – 5 years relevant work experience with data analytics, feature engineering and model development using market leading machine learning and deep learning techniques. Client facing experience will be strongly valued.
Expertise in writing production code using Python, in particular Pytorch and Tensorflow.
Fluency in data querying and manipulation using cloud-based SQL and NoSQL database technologies.
Minimum of BA/BSc degree in a quantitative degree such as Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Epidemiology, Computer Science, Engineering, or related field. Advanced degree (MA/MSc, equivalent or higher) is an advantage.
Foundational understanding of statistical techniques like (generalised)linear regression, statistical inference, clustering, time series, etc
Experience in utilising modern MLOps/DevOps approaches to manage and deploy models at scale on Azure (preferred), AWS or GCP.
Ideally, experience or a strong interest in developing Cognitive analytics solutions including NLP, Voice and Video Analytics.
Experience with Big Data analytics, including Hadoop, Spark, graph analytics would be desirable..
Additional experience with other programming languages is ideal such as Scala, R, Julia, or other programming language for big data analysis would be valued.
Ideally experience in building ML solutions within the Finance Function on at least one of the following industries - Government, Financial Services, Insurance, and Consumer and Industrial Products.

Why Deloitte?
At Deloitte we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. We value difference and embrace people with diverse backgrounds and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in different ways we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated."]

title: ['Organisation and Methods Analyst']
['EMR Analyst (Surgery & Anaesthesia)']
description:
["At Northern Health, we take care of the residents of Melbourne’s north, by providing a diverse range of health services, at Northern Hospital Epping, Broadmeadows Hospital, Craigieburn Centre and Bundoora Centre. We also collaborate with our partners to help expand the range of healthcare services offered to our culturally rich and diverse community.


Northern Health Electronic Medical Record (EMR) Project

Northern Health plans to implement an integrated Electronic Medical Record with the Vision ‘One patient’ ‘One integrated record’ and the purpose to optimise the quality and safety of our patient care. Northern Health is planning a full stack implementation to be in place by mid-2022 which will bring us to a level 5+ HIMSS EMRAM scale of EMR adoption. A large team will be hired and mobilised to plan and deliver a large scope of technical and clinical work to support the implementation and to ensure the achievement of timelines, once confirmed.

The program of work will transform how clinical care is provided to the patients and communities we serve and will be a clinically lead transformation project.

About the role:

The EMR analyst will be responsible for the analysis, design, build, configuration, testing and conversion of the EMR at Northern Health. You will be responsible for the review of existing workflows, content and configuration to contribute to the optimization of current workflows and the design of new workflows.

As an EMR analyst you will have strong clinical workflow knowledge and possess business analytic skills. You will have the ability to work autonomously and analyse clinical workflows, collect and review data in the data collection workbooks.
You will engage and facilitate agreement between Northern Health as to the design and configuration of the solution and will be responsible for facilitating system build, testing and assisting with development of training materials. You will manage all your deliverables to ensure timelines and objectives are met and you will be working collaboratively with the EMR team, Department and clinical staff for all EMR matters.
Throughout the program you will facilitate regular communication with relevant stakeholders and staff, listening to and analysing their needs and negotiating agreed outcomes. Together with program management staff, you will identify and manage program risks. Following go-live you will provide support to ensure a smooth transition for users. This role is required to commence in February 2021.


About you:
 A tertiary degree in healthcare, midwifery or science related field
 A clinical or other health related background of at least 3 years, with an interest in computerised workflows, best practise, innovation, clinical documentation and healthcare informatics
 Demonstrated experience working in a tertiary hospital environment and understanding of clinical workflows in the acute and subacute inpatient settings
 Knowledge of and experience with the Cerner EMR or equivalent EMR/Clinical systems implementations
 Critical thinking, strong analytical and troubleshooting skills to investigate and understand issues along with their clinical implications.
 Experience using common business analysis software such as Microsoft Visio and excel
 Excellent written and verbal communication skills, the ability to effectively communicate with stakeholders within the organisation with an eye for detail
 Demonstrated ability to manage and triage defects during the testing processes


We can offer:
 Health and Wellbeing programs, including our new ‘Thrive’ program
 Flexibility in the workplace and extra leave options and support
 An inclusive and culturally safe space
 Access to salary packaging, EAP, our online library and onsite car parking.


Next Steps . . .

If this opportunity sounds like the next step in your career, then we would love to hear from you. Please click on the 'Apply' button and follow the prompts. For further details, please refer to the PD and Recruitment & Information pack. Alternatively contact Ash Gaidhankar EMR PMO Manager via Ashish.Gaidhankar@nh.org.au
Work with us! Northern Health is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to attracting and retaining a diverse workforce which reflects the community we serve. Applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, as well as applicants who are LGBTIQ+, who have different abilities, or are from culturally and Linguistically Diverse Backgrounds are encouraged.


Selection Criteria Essential: Knowledge of and experience with the Cerner EMR or equivalent EMR/Clinical systems implementations
Essential: A tertiary degree in healthcare, midwifery or science related field
Essential: Demonstrated experience working in a tertiary hospital environment and understanding of clinical workflows in the acute and subacute inpatient settings
Essential: A clinical or other health related background of at least 3 years, with an interest in computerised workflows, best practise, innovation, clinical documentation and healthcare informatics"]

['Excel Based Data Analyst

title: ['Data Scientist']
description:
["Data Scientist- Sydney or Melbourne
Who is Equifax?
Equifax is a leading global data, analytics and technology company, supporting customers across 24 countries. We're devoted to building a diverse and inclusive culture, where employees engage in interesting and challenging work helping people to live their financial best. We believe that the best way to do so is by working together and giving our employees the freedom and flexibility to create their own work-life balance. Our company has been serving the Australian and New Zealand markets for over 60 years and have continuously challenged ourselves to do better, whilst consistently producing strong financial results.
The perks of being an Equifax employee within the D&A team?
Utilising cutting edge statistical/modelling tools across hundreds of data assets, collaborating with the best data minds in Australia and opportunities to work with some of our largest blue-chip customers is just the start! Equifax employs over 100 people in D&A, all gaining exposure across all phases of the D&A lifecycle. We encourage thought leadership & innovation every day.
Our people are important to us and we are devoted in ensuring that lives outside of work are supported and a successful work-life balance is achieved. We offer additional leave days as we recognise the importance of taking time out, whether that’s to catch up on some rest, celebrate a birthday, or give back to our community by volunteering. We are committed to the wellbeing of our people and provide discounted health cover and offer 24/7 support through our employee assistance program.
Our leadership team fosters a culture of ownership, they will lead, coach, mentor and listen. We support one another to feel confident to speak up and hold each other accountable to work with integrity.
What you’ll do:
The Data Scientist will hold a senior role within the Data Science team. The main responsibility of the Data Scientist is to deliver innovative decision science models and attributes that leverage Equifax’s vast data assets. These include decision areas covering the credit lifecycle, geodemographic & marketing attributes, ratings & fraud models, as well as any new areas where data driven decision making can be informed by predictive modelling.
What are we looking for?
5+ years’ experience in a similar role (as described above)
Qualification in Mathematics or Statistics. Alternatively, analytics, data science, econometrics or computer science preferred
Marketing Analytics experience
Experience using SQL, R and Python
SQL or Hive, Impala and Big Data database related query languages
Tableau for visualisation
Commercially savvy with excellent written and verbal communication skills
Extra points for any of the following:
Background in financial services, telecommunications, utilities or retail
The desire to mentor junior staff members and run projects
Experience working on cloud platforms would be advantageous
The ability to build tools as well as run them
Success attributes of an Equifax employee within D&A; does this describe you?
Accountable
Brave
Curious
Collaborative
Individualist
Trustworthy
Dedicated
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.
Get on board and potentially make the best career decision ever. Send us your resume!
Primary Location:
AUS-Melbourne
AUS-Sydney-100-Arthur
Function:
Function - Data and Analytics
Schedule:
Full time"]

title: ['Digital Analyst']
description:
['Be part of a team that values great product principles and practice
Build with autonomy, self-direction and a healthy work life balance
Full-time, permanent opportunity in Sydney or Melbourne
Qantas Loyalty is a high performing business and has a history of launching exciting new brands and services that make a difference to its millions of Frequent Flyer and Business Rewards members. Qantas Frequent Flyer and Qantas Business Rewards remain at the core of the program, while the business has evolved to include a number of new ventures and other businesses such as Qantas Money, Qantas Insurance, Qantas Hotels & Holidays and Qantas Wine.
Qantas Hotel’s commercial strategy and data-driven product process relies on data that is well-defined, accurate and consumable. As part of the Strategy, Data and Insights team, The Digital Analyst will be responsible for managing digital analytics and reporting for Qantas Hotels’ websites, with the view to improving revenue, conversion rate, and customer experience.
You will use agile and lean practices, working closely with Product Managers, Engineers, and Marketing, enabling decision making on product development, experiments and marketing efforts. You’ll manage implementation and tagging of Google and Adobe Analytics, analyse how different customer groups experience and navigate through the hotels site and create engaging, easily interpretable and memorable ways of visualizing data.
Your responsibilities:
Responsible for the effective management and delivery of accurate and actionable insights
from digital channels to the team and wider organisation
Setting up dashboards for reporting on vital metrics
Attribution analysis, data modelling, cross-channel reporting & measurement
Identify and articulate opportunities for optimisation to improve revenue, conversion rate
and customer satisfaction
Management of Web Analytics Platforms - proactively identify areas of improvement to deliver consistent and accurate tracking
Collaborate with stakeholders to identify new data capture requirements and work with
engineers to execute
Experiment tracking - assist Product Managers in set up and analysis of digital experiments
Facilitate “self service” reporting - empower and educate the team to use the available tools
Requires some travel to Sydney to foster collaboration
What you’ll bring to the role:
Tertiary qualified in business, statistics, economics, maths, software or related.
At least 3 years digital, preferably e-commerce, experience, travel or marketplace experience a plus
Experience with Web and transactional insight reporting, and a strong understanding of digital best practice
You’re the Google Analytics guru, able to bring us up to best practices and educate others
Experience with G360, Adobe Analytics, Tableau, SQL, Adobe Audience Manager, or similar tool, desirable
Data-driven mindset, seeking out both quantitative and qualitative data when making decisions
Passion for teaching and collaborating, and learning and experimenting with new ways of working
Strong business acumen and excellent communication skills and ability to interact with all levels of end users
Qantas is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at time of application.
If you’re ready to step into a culture that will challenge and excite you, submit an application and let’s explore how we go places together.']

title: ['Estate Data Business Analyst']
description:
['Ventia is one of the largest essential services providers in Australia and New Zealand. Our clients are the owners and operators of major infrastructure that is critical to our communities, and we are proud to provide the services to keep it working. No one else does exactly what we do in the way we do it.


In partnership with the Australian Defence Force we are seeking an experienced Estate Data Business Analysts to prepare and process Estate Asset information for the purpose of supporting operational Asset planning activities. This role will work alongside the Estate Data Analysts and will provide technical support to the team and client.

This is a permanent full-time position, based in Melbourne.

The key areas of accountability for this role are: Data Management, Data Integrity & Data Analysis, which also involves;
Understand and translate data from various data sources
Devise and project manage Updates and Continuous improvement to Estate Data
Provide large data extractions in formats requested.
Provide Estate Data Metrics on compliance and Assurance of Asset records.
Provide intelligent insights and advising on how to improve performance of SQL and BI reporting
Build and maintain Team dashboards to enable daily workflow decisions to be made using real time data
Train and coach team members on the efficient use of our system and processes include the roll out of continuous improvement initiatives


To be successful in this role, you will need to be an Efficient problem solver that can work effectively with a high degree of professional autonomy as well as in a team;
4 years minimum in Power BI (including proficiency with DAX queries)
Possess relevant qualifications in Data Science/Data analytics or Engineering is desirable
Demonstrated knowledge and experience with the principles and practices of reporting and data analysis
Exceptional interpersonal and customer relationship skills
Advanced skills in the use of reporting and database enquiry tools (SQL, EXCEL, Power BI)
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel (use of macro’s, pivot tables, formulas, VLOOKUPs VBA)
Demonstrated ability to undertake requirements gathering activities to deliver effective and optimised reporting and analytics services

You must be an Australian Citizen & be able to obtain a ADF Clearance.']

title: ['Business Analyst']
description:
["IDP Education Limited is an ASX listed company that is 50% owned by 38 Australian universities and headquartered in Melbourne, Australia. IDP’s core business lines include student placement to Australia, US, UK, Canada and New Zealand institutions, English-language testing and training.
IDP is evolving rapidly, we are transforming to build a globally connected community to guide and support international students along their journey to achieve their lifelong learning and career aspirations and to empower IELTS test takers to achieve the scores they need.
For over 50 years our global network of 100 offices has been helping students to achieve their goals through studying abroad. By pursuing a global education at the beginning of their careers, we help them experience life-changing opportunities.
Our success comes from connecting International students with the right course in the right institution at the right destination. We are a proud co-owner of IELTS, the world’s most popular high-stakes English language test that helps people to achieve their study and migration aspirations. We not only jointly provide the IELTS test, we help test-takers prepare and gain confidence through IELTS support tools and guidance.
If you share our passion in helping people to pursue their dreams through education and thrive in an innovative agile digital culture, then come and join us as we undergo our digital revolution.
POSITION PURPOSE
IDP are continuing to evolve IELTS operations to support our global growth and the integrity of the IELTS brand. This role will assist in the delivery of the major business transformation programme which has an initial February 2021 deliverable. The role will be pivotal in working closely with our Partner delivery teams, Business function teams and Programme teams to plan, document detailed business requirements and processes and then support staff training and roll out towards the end of project delivery.
This is a Fixed term opportunity.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Essential BA Leadership Competence

Ability to establish relationships and negotiate with people; facilitate engagement across multiple groups of people within and outside the organisation and at various levels
Ability to challenge in an impersonal and factual manner by evidencing assumptions to question the existing norms and status quo and providing alternatives
Utilize a flexible problem solving approach
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work autonomously, be self-motivated and also work effectively as a strong team player in a dynamic and fast paced environment
Select or tailor an appropriate Business Analysis approach based on the projects objects and the business constraints
Identifies and articulates the BA scope of work, decompose that scope into manageable work packages in line with the selected BA Approach, provides high level estimates for the work packages.

Global Participation
Liaise with IELTS Partners as necessary to business process changes and provide effective visibility of interactions to IDP team.
People

Demonstrate understanding and commitment to IDP’s values and quality and compliance standards in everyday dealings with the team and stakeholders.
Provide & share expertise across business change and transformation projects.

PERSON SPECIFICATION
Preferred Professional Competence

Collaboration & Facilitation: Ability to setup relationships and negotiate with people; facilitate engagement across multiple groups of people within and outside the organisation and at various levels.
Assisting with visioning, fleshing out ideas: Ability to challenge in an impersonal and factual manner by evidencing assumptions to question the existing norms and status quo and providing alternatives

Essential Skills and Experience

Strong core business analysis skills (eliciting and documenting requirements, process mapping, etc)
Minimum 2+ years of work experience as a BA in software or business process change projects
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English
Must have strong interpersonal skills and desire to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment
Must have the ability to work autonomously, be self-motivated and a strong team player
Must be able to regularly work evenings on video conferencing with people from other organisations and geographic locations

Preferred Skills & Experience

Holds a Bachelor’s Degree in Information Systems, Business Administration, or other related fields
Industry certification in Business Analysis well regarded
Prior experience and strengths in data modelling, data analysis
Prior experience or a background in software development.
High attention to detail and work ethics which encourages accuracy
Involvement in a digital transformation or multi-system integration project.

WORKING AT IDP
IDP Education’s ongoing success comes from our highly committed and caring employees around the globe. We encourage teamwork in order to leverage our people's diverse talents and expertise through effective collaboration and cooperation throughout our business. We strive to provide a working environment where people are encouraged to excel, be creative and seek new ways to solve problems, take initiative, generate opportunities and be accountable for their actions. We believe in developing dynamic, inclusive work places that encourage and celebrate cultural differences and views, and provide opportunities for personal, professional and career development all around the world. We respect diversity in our people: their ideas, work styles and perspectives as well as offering flexibility to ensure employees enjoy a satisfying balance of work and personal life."]

title: ['Business Analyst']
description:
["Munro Footwear Group (MFG) is Australia's leading retailer and wholesaler of fashion footwear, owning and operating some of Australia's most iconic brands. Our impressive portfolio includes Midas, Mollini, Mountfords, Wanted, Williams, Mathers as well as Australia's most popular online footwear retailer, Styletread! Proudly Australian owned, we continue to lead the footwear industry through our rapid growth and expansion.
About your Next Role
We have an exciting opportunity for a Business Analyst to join our CX team. Reporting to the Digital Project Manager, you will be the vital link between our system integration and our business objectives by performing detailed requirements analysis, documenting processes, and performing user acceptance testing. You will be performing detailed requirements analysis, document processes, and perform user acceptance testing. To succeed, you should have a strong technical background, a natural analytical way of thinking and an ability to explain difficult concepts to non-technical users as well as business concepts to technical staff.

Responsibilities include:

Collaborating with developers and subject matter experts to establish the technical vision and analyse trade-offs between usability and performance needs
Proactively communicate and collaborate with external and internal customers to analyse systems integration needs
Performing requirements analysis and translating results into technical features and user stories.
Execution of full procedure documentation for all Web, CRM and PIM systems including wireframes
Performing requirements analysis and translating results into technical features and user stories.
Optimizing processes to improve operational efficiency
Running SQL Queries to extract and analyse relevant data
End to End testing of integration flows
Reporting bugs during testing
Escalation of critical issues to stakeholders
Staying abreast of industry trends and technologies
Performing requirements analysis and translating results into technical features and user stories.
Reporting on status to the stakeholders and provide estimates for assigned tasks
Monitoring deliverables and ensuring timely completion of projects

The successful candidate will have:

Minimum 1 year of relevant experience as an Integration Business Analyst or similar position
Proven ability to analyse and interpret business needs and to transform them into clearly defined requirements and acceptance criteria
Strong written and verbal communication skills including technical writing skills
Experience with data integration in a multi-faceted architecture
Outstanding understanding of retail and mobile/web development
Excellent technical knowledge of digital technologies, e-commerce ecosystems, content management systems
Proactive approach, continuous seeking for ways to achieve business growth and improvement
An IT, Business or Relevant Degree or Experience
Experience in eCommerce and Magento is advantageous

Benefits and Culture
We offer a friendly, welcoming team environment where continued support, training and generous employee benefits are provided, including discount across all brands and subsidised personal training sessions. As a privately owned company we thrive on building great relationships with our team and our customers. We work to make things happen and when a job is done, big or small we celebrate!
This is an exciting opportunity to join Munro Footwear Group as we continue to grow! If this sounds like you then join us by applying now!"]

title: ['Configuration and Data Management Analyst']
description:
['About us
At Saab Australia, we’re pioneering Australia’s capability to defend and protect itself with the ongoing development of advanced defence and security technologies. We develop everything from combat, communications and security systems, to mixed reality and cyber security solutions. Over 30 years, we’ve built a proud reputation of driving solutions that keep us ahead of today’s complex challenges and are now seeking our employees of tomorrow to join our thinking edge, as we head toward our next innovative chapter.
Apply today to join our crew and deliver solutions with purpose.

The role
As part of our Land group, the Configuration and Data Management Analyst will lead configuration and data management functions across all projects, with a particular focus on furthering the development of Saab’s deployable health solutions.
Further, the successful candidate will:
Develop project configuration and data management processes in line with ASDEFCON requirements
Manage project related tools, information systems, and bills of materials
Facilitate Configuration Control Board (CCB) meetings and manage/track the outputs and changes - e.g. Engineering Change Proposals (ECP)
Participate in Functional and Physical Configuration Audits (FCA/PCA) and associated reviews
Capture configuration Status Account Information (CSA)
Ensure integrity of the data set/configuration environment via regular audits

About you
Your skills and experience will include:
5 + years in defence in a complex project, engineering or production management environment
Configuration management in an ASDEFCON environment
Familiarity with TRAMM-L related requirements applicable to defence industry configuration control
Managing BoMs and creating process documentation and work flows
Training users in configuration management tools and/or engineering data management systems
ISO 9001 certified quality management systems (highly desirable)
Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems (desirable)
Implementing Product Life Cycle Management (PLM) systems (desirable)
Tertiary qualification in a related discipline (desirable)
As Defence security clearance is required for this role, applicants must be Australian citizens and eligible to obtain and maintain the appropriate clearance.
Culture and benefits
We now employ over 500 Australians and are committed to fostering a culture of excellence and enriching the employee experience. We offer a fresh and vibrant workplace, with a focus on continuous learning, collaboration and knowledge sharing. We’re an open minded and supportive organisation, where your health, well-being and work-life balance are emphasised and you’ll have the opportunity to develop a long term career.
For further information on our offering, you may visit the page adjacent: https://www.saab.com/markets/australia/careers/saab-life
Applications
Click ‘Apply’ to submit your CV and cover letter in support of your application. You may contact our careers team at careers.mailbox@au.saabgroup.com for a copy of the full position description.
Saab Australia is an Equal Opportunity Employer and encourages Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders to apply. We also welcome applications from individuals with culturally diverse backgrounds.
Saab Australia is a proud supporter of the Veterans’ Employment Program and welcomes the interest of ex-service members, veterans and their families.']

title: ['Cyber Risk Analyst']
description:
["About Us

The Endeavour Group ambition is bold, we want to be the world's best drinks retailer. We know that expectations of retail have never been higher so our transactions must be instant, and our services must be intuitive and personal. We are embarking on our next generation of growth, and we want you to be an influential part of it.

Our family of leading brands is well respected and highly visible throughout Australia, New Zealand and the world; from Dan Murphy’s, our market leading destination drinks merchant, to our local convenience offering at BWS, and our Cellarmaster wines and Langtons businesses with each of them commanding a leadership position in their respective category.

About the Role:

Our Cyber Risk Analyst will identify, triage and manage cybersecurity risk within the Endeavour group and its banners. An Internally Facing role with a strong need to manage relationships with stakeholders to ensure the optimal management of cybersecurity-related risk for 80% of the role.The role will also be trained in Operational cybersecurity, to act as required in relation to cybersecurity incident response. The Operational element will be approximately 20% of the role.

The successful applicant must be able to complete JCSC Cyber training

What will you do?

20% of the role will be the triage of line 1 security events and escalation to the Line two service of any validated events.Maintain and evolve the EGL cyber risk profile to ensure the organisation operates within an acceptable cyber risk appetite.Establish and maintain an internal team and set of internal relationships in support of the Cyber Security Strategy.Support business project delivery through providing line 1 cybersecurity risk advice as requiredWorks across the IT and trading teams to ensure appropriate focus on cyber risk management and appropriate prioritiesDrive continuous improvement via data analysis of risk and vulnerability findings.

Working with peers and reporting to the Chief Information Security Officer the identification, triage and management of cyber risk for EGL, covering;
Cyber related business risk
Network Security
End-user computing
Cloud computing
Hosting and storage


About you:
You will have an innovative mindset and enjoy working on greenfield projects as well as this you will have the ability to manage stakeholder relationships at all levels. Active in the Cyber community and enjoy looking for ways to update your current skill-set.

Understanding of business and industry direction, IT trends, key venUudors and their capabilities
Understanding of the technology landscape and who/how to engage
Demonstrated experience in Business Process & IT Systems


Desirable:
 Experience in large operational and/or Retail environment

Grow with Endeavour Drinks

Endeavour Drinks comprises a diverse range of drinks businesses including BWS, Dan Murphy’s, ALH and Pinnacle Drinks. We are focused on growing and transforming our businesses to meet the changing needs of customers and we’re driven by a culture that puts our customers and team first. Our ambition is to connect everyone with a drinks experience they'll love.
As an inclusive, team-first company, our people are at the core of everything we do.

We care deeply about creating a workplace where our team members feel valued, respected and empowered. We are committed to providing equal opportunity regardless of gender identity, ethnicity, disability or sexual orientation and we are proud to be recognised as a Gold Tier Employer in the Australian Workplace Equality Index for LGBTQ+ inclusion.
We value flexibility, and encourage our team members to work in ways that meet their work/life commitments and support their wellbeing.

We work hard to create a safe and inclusive environment for all, and most importantly, we're all about creating better experiences – for our customers and for each other.

We’d love to hear from You
If you meet a number of the requirements, but not all, we encourage you to submit your application. You can follow us on LinkedIn or see more opportunities via www.wowcareers.com.au. #Li #Work180"]

title: ['Graduate Business Consultant/Data Analyst']
description:
['Ideal for a graduate with strong analytical skills
Work closely with the co-founder and previous graduate hires
Training and mentorship from experience professionals
About the Client

Our client is a specialist Licensing business. Their team is made up of ex Oracle, SAP & IBM vice presidents, senior directors, former Oracle licence auditors, contracting professionals and business analysist. They assist clients in optimising their Licence footprint and maintaining visibility of their compliance position. They have extensive local and international experience working with clients in the selection and adoption of on-premise and cloud-based platforms. They advises clients on best practices, adoption, business case development and which licensing models to adopt. Our in-depth knowledge of the Oracle, SAP & IBM pricing, policies and solution sets enables our clients to extract maximum value from their platforms, fully leveraging their technology investments.

Duties

Our client is looking for a graduate to join their fast expanding realm of Software Asset Management. The successful candidate will;
Interpreting data, analysing results using statistical techniques relevant to Software Asset Management across multiple vendors.
Developing and implementing data analyses, data collection systems and other strategies that optimise statistical efficiency and quality.
Acquiring data from primary or secondary data sources and maintaining databases/data systems.
Researching customer requirements and provide ongoing reports
Updating spreadsheet as new data comes in and liaising with customer contacts from technical through to Senior Executive level.
Checking customer contracts and comparing required licenses against utilised licenses.
Working out strategies to help customer become compliant.
Identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Filter and “clean” data by reviewing computer reports and work with management to prioritize business and information needs
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities
For more information on ProForce and what we do, check out our Facebook page https://www.facebook.com/proforceaustralia or visit our website: http://proforce.net.au/
*You must have the right to live and work in Australia to apply for these positions*
PROGBC0092817']

title: ['Business Analyst and Project Delivery']
['Business Intelligence\xa0Analyst']
description:
['Job no: 493215

Categories: Information and Communication Technology

Business Intelligence Analyst, Glen Waverly, City of Monash
Fixed-term – 12 Months, BAND 8, $114,775 - $128,610 p/a, plus superannuation

The City of Monash is a dynamic organisation committed to providing excellence in service delivery. Located in the eastern region, Monash is a cosmopolitan and culturally diverse city, close to the demographic centre of Melbourne.

This is an exciting opportunity for a BI professional with strong technical expertise in Microsoft BI stack to deliver in a challenging and dynamic environment. You will part of the Digital Transformation project team focusing on the development and supporting of enterprise-level Business Intelligence platform.

About the Role:
As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will join a greenfield implementation of Microsoft stack data warehouse, data orchestration, integration, ETL processes, automated workflows, automated forms, dashboard and reporting via BI tools. Work across the organisation to consult, understand systems, challenges, research, develop, present and support the implementation of Data Analytics platform and services.

The successful candidate will have:
Degree Qualification in Computer Science/Information Technology or relevant, with several years’ experience

Experience on Migrating SQL & Oracle database to Azure Data Lake, Azure data lake Analytics, Azure SQL Database, Data Bricks and Azure SQL Data warehouse and Controlling and granting database access and Migrating On-premise databases to Azure Data lake store using Azure Data factory

Develop complex calculated measures using Data Analysis Expression language (DAX)

Performed data cleansing, enrichment, mapping tasks and automated data validation processes to ensure meaningful and accurate data was reported efficiently

Experience in ETL architecture design and implementation across other greenfield environments

Experience in the complete Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) process by analysing business requirements and understanding the functional workflow of information from source systems to destination systems

What We Offer:
As a City of Monash employee, your personal and professional development is a key focus. You will have access to a vibrant health and well-being program, flexible working arrangements and training opportunities.

How to Apply:
Please submit your resume along with a cover letter outlining your experience and how it relates to the role.

Applications are currently open, with a closing date of Friday, 27/11/2020 at 11:55pm .

Enquiries:
If you would like to discuss this role further, please contact, Adil Khan on 03 9518 3061 or at Adil.Khan@monash.vic.gov.au .

Monash Council values flexible working arrangements and embraces workplace diversity , inclusion and equity , including children and young people.

We are committed to being a child safe organisation and have zero tolerance to child abuse.']

title: ['Technical Business Analyst - Junior-Mid Level']
description:
["Enterprise project environment
Melbourne CBD
Contract or permanent
We are currently looking for a Junior to Mid Level Business Analyst on a contract or permanent basis. Adding to our existing team of consultants, this role is assigned to of our key projects based in Melbourne CBD. (Working remotely at this stage)

title: ['Merchandise Data Business Analyst']
description:
['Work type: Permanent Full Time
Location: VIC Metro
Categories: Information Technology, Merchandise - Planner
About Kmart

With more than 200 stores and employing over 34,000 people, Kmart is proud to be one of Australia and New Zealand’s largest and most successful retailers.

Serving the needs of Australian families is at the core of who we are as a business, that’s why we are driven to be the place customers rely on for low prices and making every day living brighter.

Culture

You’ll be joining a dynamic team with a fantastic culture where diversity is openly celebrated, and you’ll be challenged and supported to achieve personal and business goals. Expect a work environment that is highly collaborative, fast-paced, inclusive and progressive - with no two days the same!

What we’re looking for?

Kmart currently has a requirement for a Merchandise Data Business Analyst to join the team. This role will be responsible for building a data governance operating model and data governance roadmaps including strategic priorities.

You will strive to ensure sustainable, relevant solutions to business data problems are explored, assessed and delivered as well as researching future trends and ensuring project activities and roadmaps are aligned with business, change and communication strategies.

About You

To be successful in this role, your previous experience in data govenance related roles, coupled wih your industry knowledge around data integrity and data protection management practices will hold you in good stead.

Your skills and experience in the following areas will also help you succeed:

Change management – liaising wih stakeholders and leading as an agent of change both formally and informally;
Communicating and influencing is a collaborative and profeesional manner is essential to this roles success;
Delivering Governance projects wilst ensuring business processes are continuously analysed and improved.

Our benefits

Development opportunities across Kmart and the Wesfarmers Group
Excellent remuneration, a generous bonus scheme and access to the Wesfarmers share plan
Discount card for Kmart, Coles, Target and Officeworks
Support of flexible working
Casual dress and free onsite parking

title: ['Business Analyst (Information Co-ordinator)']
description:
['Victoria Police
Forensic Services Department
Forensic Intelligence & IT Management Unit
VPS-4 Ongoing role available

About the role:
The purpose of this role is to support to various clients across the Forensic Services Department through the development and regular provision of business reports, extracts and dashboards. Stakeholder engagement skills and individual initiative will be required.
Victoria Police is a contemporary and agile workplace and supports flexible working arrangements.

Your duties will include:

Developing and running queries, processes and reports primarily using SAS-EG, but also with other query and data management tools, including QL and open source languages.
Analysing FSD data and cleansing as required.
Developing and applying knowledge and understanding of FSD and other Victoria Police systems and datasets, integrating data from multiple sources into cohesive, business-oriented outputs.
Liaising and working with VPFSD clients to produce tailored reports, often within short timeframes.
Liaising and working with other partners within VPFSD and Victoria Police more broadly on projects relating to development of new business insights, applying contemporary analytics techniques to capitalise on data holdings.

As the successful applicant, you will have:

A relevant tertiary qualification, preferably in data analytics and statistics.
Experience in working in a scientific setting.
Highly developed skills in developed queries and integrated analytics products within SAS, SQL and open source coding languages.
Strong communication and engagement skills to glean analytics needs and present developed product.
Excellent abilities to identify opportunities and develop methodologies to supply analytics to scientist and law enforcement consumers.

Requirements and relevant information:

Position will be located at 31 Forensic Drive Macleod 3085.
Commencing salary will be at base level of salary range.
Applicants must be an Australian Citizen, Permanent Resident or hold a valid work permit or visa.
The successful candidate will be required to provide a DNA sample (buccal swab) for use in laboratory quality control procedures (elimination purposes only).
The successful candidate will be required to undergo pre-employment checks which may include fingerprint checks and misconduct screening.

Your application must include:

Resume
Response to the Key Selection Criteria – found in the position description attached to the job advertisement.

Applications close midnight, Thursday 26th November 2020.
Please Note: All applications will need to be submitted through the Job Skills Exchange (JSE) website or the Victorian Government careers website (Careers.vic). Applications will not be accepted via other platforms or email.
For further information on this role please contact: Tamara Fitzpatrick via email tamara.fitzpatrick@police.vic.gov.au
If you have a disability/medical condition and require a copy of this advertisement and attached documentation in an accessible format or would like to discuss an access requirements/reasonable adjustment for the recruitment process, please contact VPS Recruitment via email hr.fsd@police.vic.gov.au or on (03) 9450-9760.

About Us:
Victoria Police is a large organisation employing police, public servants and protective services officers. Victoria Police provides support to the community 24 hours a day, 365 days of the year.
At Victoria Police our goal is for our workforce to reflect the diverse community we serve. We continually seek to attract and retain a diverse workforce which includes people of all genders, ages, religions, disability, sexual orientation, family and caring responsibilities and cultures including people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander heritage.
Victoria Police is a contemporary and agile workplace and support flexible working arrangements
Find out what it is like working as a Victorian Public Servant for Victoria Police: https://www.police.vic.gov.au/vps']

title: ['Senior Data Analyst']
description:
['Job no: 508789
Work type: Permanent - Full Time
Location: VIC

Permanent Full-Time Position
St. Kilda Road Location
Join ASX100 iconic brand in its Data & Analytics journey

Who we are
When you start to think of waste as a resource, it opens up a world of possibilities. Cleanaway is the largest waste management company in Australia providing sustainable waste management solutions to a range of customers including councils, small businesses, large corporate entities and government agencies.

Your new role

Cleanaway is an essential service with environmental causes and sustainability in mind. In order to be efficient and to succeed in its good to a great journey, many data sources need to be harnessed. The data landscape is vast, incorporating huge amounts of data in all different shapes and sizes: Everything form Telemetry, IoT, trucks GPS and weight-bearing loads, production lines to HR systems, ERP, sales and more; Tens of source systems and complex data challenges. As a Data Analyst with 5+ years of experience, you would be part of the Data & Analytics team and work closely with Data Engineers, Data Scientists, DataOps, Product Owners and Business Analysts.

Develop data analytics and report solutions that drive decision; Work closely with different stakeholders.
Provide expert advice and guidance on data quality-related activities
Liaise with solutions architects, business analysts, and other developers to ensure all deliveries are supported by the correct architectural implementation
Work closely with Data Engineers, DataOps and Data Scientists to develop the Data & Analytics framework – Data Lake, Enterprise Data Warehouse solutions, ad-hoc reports and insights.
Support business users’ self-service via reporting tools such as PowerBI; Provide analytical support to business projects
Own, enhance and support the company’s data dictionary, business glossary and reports’ catalogue
Support and mentoring of Data Analysts to efficiently deliver a consistent level of service to their key stakeholders

Your skills and experience
Experience developing Power BI reports and visualisations on Azure eco-system and on-prem environments
Excellent communication and stakeholder management
Demonstrable experience in delivering insightful analysis and reporting solutions
Experience participating in scrum-based agile teams
PowerBI – Complex DAX writing, Power Query M
Sound knowledge in SQL, ERD and Dimensional Modelling
Knowledge of ETL process and tools (Informatica, Talend, Databricks, Azure Data Factory)
Degree qualified in a relevant commercial, analytical or mathematical discipline

What we offer

High growth business ASX 100 listed
Discounts on private health insurance
Collaborative and supportive team environment
Competitive pay and benefits
Opportunity to work on integrations

How to apply

If this sounds like the opportunity you’ve been waiting for, please forward your resume and cover letter by clicking the Apply button below. Cleanaway encourages and values diversity and inclusion. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply.

www.cleanaway.com.au

['2 x Technical Business Analyst required
Attrative Day rate

title: ['Senior Analyst']
description:
["Senior Analyst - Marketing Analytics - Endeavour X
Join Endeavour Group’s newly established data and analytics team
Work on a wide range of high impact projects
Alphington location, with WFH flexibility


Our Mission:
Endeavour has established a new data and analytics capability to deliver on our ambition to be a customer and insight led organisation. This team is charged with empowering Endeavour Drinks to create the best experiences for our customers & team through data and insights.
Within Endeavour the Analytics team are commercial business partners and advisors who understand the business’ strategic direction and needs and collaborate to ensure robust product and customer data for advanced analytics and reporting. We are expanding the team, and looking for someone who can deliver analytics to measure and optimise our ecomm and paid marketing channels.
As part of the analytics team, you will also be able to leverage the capability that exists across the other team members. By developing strong relationships, shared ways of working and leveraging the skills of the team we aim to build a strong analytics capability and embed data and insight into the business.

About the role:
The senior analyst will be working across a wide range of projects to evaluate the effectiveness of our ATL marketing activity and will also be responsible for leading, coaching and developing more junior team members as well as sharing approaches and best practices across the Endeavour data and analytics chapters.

Responsibilities will include but are not limited to:
Provide leadership and best practice marketing and ecomm analytics strategies across Endeavour owned properties
Produce data, analytics and insights from disparate data sources across Endeavour drinks, including Adobe, GCP, Azure and other proprietary databases.
Assist in the development of test and learn experiments to drive key organisational initiatives
Providing both ongoing and ad hoc reporting, analysis and insights in a timely manner
Enable the business to improve the efficiency of marketing and the effectiveness of our channels through the use of data and insights
Sharing approaches and best practices across the Endeavour data and analytics chapters
Work within team norms, standards and procedures to provide consistency across the business
Establish credible relationships with business stakeholders.


Who we are looking for:
We are looking for an experienced analyst with the ability to support and drive great team dynamics as part of a newly established team in the business.
Communication skills are critical to this role; you will have the ability to translate complicated analytics methods and results into plain language, both in speaking and writing, and work with a wide range of technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Requirements include, but are not limited to:
5+ years experience in a digital or retail business or marketing agency with experience in data, analytics or insights
Demonstrated capability in developing analytics and insight and communicating this to stakeholders to improve customer satisfaction and business outcomes.
Experience working across at least 2 relevant areas: digital analytics, marketing analytics, analytics development, data development, CRO, reporting, data visualisation, insight delivery
Experience in auditing and improving analytics setup
Demonstrable ability to build collaborative relationships with a diverse range of stakeholders within analytics chapters and across cross functional squads
Ability to prioritise multiple concurrent pieces of work and deliver to agreed milestones whilst communicating any changes in scope or timelines
Demonstrable marketing, ecom or sales analytics experience.
Proven experience of continuously improving individual outputs and contributing to the aim of the team to do the same.
Experience working in an agile organisation or with agile technology teams.

About Us
The Endeavour Drinks Group ambition is bold, we want to be the world's best drinks retailer. We know that expectations of retail have never been higher so our transactions must be instant, and our services must be intuitive and personal. We are embarking on our next generation of growth, and we want you to be an influential part of it.
Our family of leading brands is well respected and highly visible throughout Australia, New Zealand and the world; from Dan Murphy’s, our market leading destination drinks merchant, to our local convenience offering at BWS, and our Cellarmasterwines and Langtons businesses with each of them commanding a leadership position in their respective category.
